0.content: The gangway tube the dock had extended was a more elaborate version of the one he’d tumbled through to reach Haniwa, designed for use in the spindle’s rotation gravity. A corrugated tunnel, articulated by integral hydraulic members, each segment ringed with a loop of tough, nonslip plastic, the loops serving as the rungs of a ladder. The gangway had snaked its way around Haniwa; it was horizontal, where it joined Garvey’ s lock, but curved up sharply and to the left, a vertical climb around the curvature of the yacht’s hull.
0.title: Gangway tube the dock had extended is a more elaborate version of the one he'd tumbled through to reach Haniwa, designed for use in the spindle's rotation gravity. A corrugated tunnel, artic
0.abstract: gangway tube the dock had extended is a more elaborate version of the one he'd tumbled through to reach Haniwa, designed for use in the spindle's rotation gravity. A corrugated tunnel, articulating at its ends by means of hinges and pivots so as to be able to fold flat when not in use.

1.content: One unit made it back to Helsinki, Case.” Case shrugged, sipped coffee. “You’re a console cowboy. The prototypes of the programs you use to crack industrial banks were developed for Screaming Fist. For the assault on the Kirensk computer nexus. Basic module was a Nightwing micro light, a pilot, a matrix deck, a jockey. We were running a virus called Mole. The Mole series was the first generation of real intrusion programs.” “Icebreakers,” Case said, over the rim of the red mug. “Ice from ICE, intrusion countermeasures electronics.”
1.title: Intrusion countermeasures electronics (ICE), intrusion programs (Mole) and icebreakers (ice from ICE, intrusion countermeasures electronics (ICE), intrusion programs (Mole) and icebreakers (
1.abstract: A method for detecting unauthorized access to an electronic device is disclosed. The method comprises the following steps: obtaining at least one data packet transmitted over a communication channel of the electronic device; analyzing the at least one data packet in order to determine whether or not the at least one data packet has been tampered with; if it is determined that the at least one data packet has been tampered with, then modifying the at least one data packet according to predetermined rules so as to render the at least one data packet non-tampered; and retransmitting the modified at least one data packet over the communication channel.

2.content: But this was a view. A dark wave of rubble rose against a colorless sky, beyond its crest the bleached, half-melted skeletons of city towers. The rubble wave was textured like a net, rusting steel rods twisted gracefully as fine string, vast slabs of concrete still clinging there. The foreground might once have been a city square; there was a sort of stump, something that suggested a fountain. Atitsbase,thechildrenandthesoldierwerefrozen.Thetableauwasconfusingatfirst. Molly must have read it correctly before Case had quite assimilated it, because he felt her tense.
2.title: Method for producing a tableau with children and a soldier in a ruined city at the base of a frozen wave of rubble rising against a colorless sky beyond whose crest the bleached, half-melted skeletons of
2.abstract: A method for producing a tableau with children and a soldier in a ruined city at the base of a frozen wave of rubble rising against a colorless sky beyond whose crest the bleached, half-melted skeletons of gulls are seen.

3.content: “Stimulants. Central nervous system stimulants. Extremely powerful central nervous system stimulants.”
3.title: Stimulants, pharmaceutical compositions and methods of use thereof
3.abstract: Provided herein are compounds of Formula (I):or a pharmaceutically acceptable salt or solvate thereof, wherein the variables are as defined herein. Also provided herein are pharmaceutical compositions comprising a compound of Formula (I) or a pharmaceutically acceptable salt or solvate thereof, and methods of using such compounds in the treatment of cognitive deficits associated with neurodegenerative disorders.

4.content: She brought an oblong box from beneath the counter. The lid was yellow cardboard, stamped with a crude image of a coiled cobra with a swollen hood. Inside were eight identical tissue-wrapped cylinders. He watched while mottled brown fingers stripped the paper from one. She held the thing up for him to examine, a dull steel tube with a leather thong at one end and a small bronze pyramid at the other. She gripped the tube with one hand, the pyramid between her other thumb and forefinger, and pulled. Three oiled, telescoping segments of tightly wound coil spring slid out and locked. “Cobra,” she said.
4.title: Mechanical cobra
4.abstract: A mechanical cobra is disclosed. The mechanical cobra comprises a body, a tail and a head. The body has a first end and a second end opposite to the first end in a longitudinal direction of the body. The tail is connected to the first end of the body. The head is connected to the second end of the body.

5.content: Afterimage of a single hair-fine line of red light. Seared concrete beneath the thin soles of his shoes. Her white sneakers flashing, close to the curving wall now and again the ghost line of the laser branded across his eye, bobbing in his vision as he ran.
5.title: Apparatus and method for generating an afterimage of a single hair-fine line of red light
5.abstract: Provided is an apparatus for generating an afterimage of a single hair-fine line of red light, the apparatus including: a plurality of LEDs configured to emit different wavelengths of light; a controller configured to control driving of the plurality of LEDs such that at least some of the plurality of LEDs are turned off while others of the plurality of LEDs are turned on so as to generate an afterimage of a single hair-fine line of red light; and a lens disposed in front of the plurality of LEDs. Also provided is a method for generating an afterimage of a single hair-fine line of red light, the method including: providing a plurality of LEDs configured to emit different wavelengths of light; controlling driving of the plurality of LEDs such that at least some of the plurality of LEDs are turned off while others

6.content: The lights dimmed. “Le Restaurant Vingtieme Siecle,” said a disembodied voice with a pronounced Sprawl accent, “proudly presents the holographic cabaret of Mr. Peter Riviera.” Scattered applause from the other tables. A waiter lit a single candle and placed it in the center of their table, then began to remove the dishes. Soon a candle flickered at each of the restaurant’s dozen tables, and drinks were being poured. “What’s happening?” Case asked Armitage, who said nothing.
6.title: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer-readable storage medium, for holographic cabaret. In some implementations, a method includes determining, by one or more processing devices, a plurality
6.abstract: methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer-readable storage medium, for holographic cabaret. In some implementations, a method includes determining, by one or more processing devices, a plurality

7.content: You reached it through an alley off Baiitsu, where an elevator waited at the foot of a transparent shaft. The elevator, like Cheap Hotel, was an afterthought, lashed to the building with bamboo and epoxy. Case climbed into the plastic cage and used his key, an unmarked length of rigid magnetic tape.
7.title: Elevator to nowhere
7.abstract: An elevator system includes an elevator car, a drive motor coupled to the elevator car and configured to move the elevator car between first and second floors of a building. The elevator system also includes a controller communicatively coupled to the drive motor. The controller is configured to control movement of the elevator car from the first floor to the second floor by moving the elevator car upwardly in response to detecting that the elevator car has been at the first floor for more than a predetermined amount of time. The controller is further configured to control movement of the elevator car from the second floor to the first floor by moving the elevator car downwardly in response to detecting that the elevator car has been at the second floor for more than a predetermined amount of time.

8.content: “Is this a test? It’s a loyalty check. It must be a loyalty check.” He wiped the palms of his hands on the thighs of his orange suit.
8.title: Method and apparatus for performing a loyalty check
8.abstract: A method of performing a loyalty check is provided. The method includes receiving, from a mobile device associated with a customer, a request to perform a loyalty check; determining whether the customer is enrolled in a loyalty program; responsive to determining that the customer is not enrolled in the loyalty program, providing an indication that the customer is not enrolled in the loyalty program; and responsive to determining that the customer is enrolled in the loyalty program, presenting one or more loyalty rewards available to the customer. A computer-readable storage medium storing instructions executable by at least one processor to perform the method described above is also provided.

9.content: “Wintermute managed to get it stuck in the back of a drawer,” Molly said, carefully inserting the Chubb key’s cylindrical shaft into the notched opening in the face of the blank, rectangular door. “He killed the little kid who put it there.” The key rotated smoothly when she tried it. “The head,” Case said, “there’s a panel in the back of the head. Zircons on it.
9.title:
Chubb key with zirconia inserts
Summarize the content into a title:
A chubb key with zirconia inserts is disclosed herein. The chubb key includes a body
9.abstract: receiving a plurality of recesses configured to receive at least one locking pawl, and an insert positioned between each pair of adjacent recesses of the plurality of recesses; wherein the insert comprises a top surface having a first radius of curvature that corresponds to a second radius of curvature of a bottom surface of the respective recess such that when the insert is received in the respective recess there is substantially no gap formed between the top surface of the insert and the bottom surface of the respective recess thereby preventing debris from interfering with movement of the at least one locking pawl within the respective recess during operation of the chubb key.

10.content: Reflected colors flowed across Molly’s lenses as the men circled. The holograms were ten-power magnifications; at ten, the knives they held were just under a meter long. The knife-fighter’s grip is the fencer’s grip, Case remembered, the fingers curled, thumb aligned with blade. The knives seemed to move of their own accord, gliding with a ritual lack of urgency through the arcs and passes of their dance, point passing point, as the men waited for an opening.
10.title: Method and apparatus for fighting with knives
10.abstract: A method of fighting with knives is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of: (a) positioning an opponent's knife blade in front of one's own body; (b) deflecting the opponent's knife blade away from one's own body by striking the opponent's knife blade with one's own knife blade, thereby causing the opponent's knife blade to move laterally relative to one's own knife blade so that the opponent's knife blade moves behind one's own knife blade; and (c) grabbing the opponent's knife handle while the opponent's knife blade is behind one's own knife blade. An apparatus for fighting with knives is also disclosed.

11.content: The fingers moved. Riviera raised the hand to his mouth and began to lick the tips of the fingers. The nails were coated with a burgundy lacquer. A hand, Case saw, but not a severed hand; the skin swept back smoothly, unbroken and unscarred. He remembered a tattooed lozenge of vatgrown flesh in the window of a Ninsei surgical boutique.
11.title: Case of the disembodied hand
11.abstract: Computer-implemented methods, computer program products, and systems are provided for generating an avatar. The method may include obtaining one or more images of a user's body part; processing the one or more images to generate a three-dimensional (3D) model of the user's body part; storing the 3D model in a database; determining whether the 3D model is stored in the database; when the 3D model is stored in the database, retrieving the 3D model from the database; transmitting the 3D model to a computing device associated with the user; displaying the 3D model on a display screen of the computing device; receiving input indicating that the displayed 3D model is to be replaced with another 3D model; replacing the displayed 3D model with the other 3D model; and causing at least a portion of the other 3D model to be displayed on the display screen.

12.content: All the speed he took, all the turns he’d taken and the corners he’d cut in Night City, and still he’d see the matrix in his sleep, bright lattices of logic unfolding across that colorless void… The Sprawl was a long strange way home over the Pacific now, and he was no console man, no cyberspace cowboy. Just another hustler, trying to make it through. But the dreams came on in the Japanese night like live wire voodoo and he’d cry for it, cry in his sleep, and wake alone in the dark, curled in his capsule in some coffin hotel, his hands clawed into the bedslab, temper foam bunched between his fingers, trying to reach the console that wasn’t there.
12.title: Cyberpunk 2077: A Novel Based on the Video Game by Mike
12.abstract: A novel entitled Cyberpunk 2077: A Novel Based on the Video Game by Mike Pondsmith is disclosed.

13.content: He robbed a bank in Wichita. The record grew vague, shadowy, the gaps longer. One day, he said, in a taped segment that suggested chemical interrogation, everything had gone gray. Translated French medical records explained that a man without identification had been taken to a Paris mental health unit and diagnosed as schizophrenic.
13.title: Bank robbery in Wichita
13.abstract: A method of robbing a bank includes the steps of (1) identifying a target bank, (2) determining an amount of money to be stolen from the target bank, and (3) purchasing one or more firearms. The method further includes the steps of (4) traveling to the target bank, (5) wearing a disguise while at the target bank, (6) entering the target bank, (7) approaching a teller station within the target bank, (8) demanding that the teller hand over the determined amount of money, and (9) leaving the target bank after receiving the determined amount of money.

14.content: “What is this thing?” he asked the Hosaka. “Parcel for me.” “Data transfer from Bockris Systems GmbH, Frankfurt, advises, under coded transmission, that content of shipment is Kuang Grade Mark Eleven penetration program. Bockris further advises that interface with Ono-Sendai Cyberspace 7 is entirely compatible and yields optimal penetration capabilities, particularly with regard to existing military systems…” “How about an AI?” “Existing military systems and artificial intelligences.”
14.title: Penetration program for Kuang Grade Mark Eleven penetration system
14.abstract: A method of using an eleventh-grade mark eleven (11G M11) penetration system is disclosed. In one embodiment, the method comprises providing at least one projectile and launching the at least one projectile into a target from a predetermined distance in accordance with a predetermined trajectory to cause the at least one projectile to penetrate the target; determining that the at least one projectile has successfully penetrated the target by detecting debris ejected from the target as a result of being penetrated by the at least one projectile; and modifying the predetermined trajectory if the at least one projectile does not successfully penetrate the target within a predetermined period of time.

15.content: “Here,” the Finn said. “This is it.” They floated in the center of a perfectly square room, walls and ceiling paneled in rectangular sections of dark wood. The floor was covered by a single square of brilliant carpet patterned after a microchip, circuits traced in blue and scarlet wool. In the exact center of the room, aligned precisely with the carpet pattern, stood a square pedestal of frosted white glass. “The Villa Straylight,” said a jeweled thing on the pedestal, in a voice like music, “is a body grown in upon itself, a Gothic folly. Each space in Straylight is in some way secret, this endless series of chambers linked by passages, by stairwells vaulted like intestines, where the eye is trapped in narrow curves, carried past ornate screens, empty alcoves…” “Essay of 3Jane’s,” the Finn said, producing his Partagas.
15.title: Villa Straylight
15.abstract: A villa straylight is disclosed. The villa straylight comprises a housing having an upper portion and a lower portion, wherein the upper portion of the housing has at least one opening for allowing light to pass therethrough; a diffuser positioned in the upper portion of the housing so as to be aligned with the at least one opening such that light passing through the at least one opening is diffused by the diffuser before being emitted outwardly from the upper portion of the housing; and a reflector positioned in the upper portion of the housing so as to be aligned with the at least one opening such that light passing through the at least one opening is reflected by the reflector toward the diffuser prior to being diffused by the diffuser.

16.content: The antique arm whined as he reached for another mug. It was a Russian military prosthesis, a seven-function force-feedback manipulator, cased in grubby pink plastic. “You are too much the artiste, Herr Case.” Ratz grunted; the sound served him as laughter. He scratched his overhang of white-shirted belly with the pink claw. “You are the artiste of the slightly funny deal.”
16.title: Apparatus, method, and computer program product for determining an artiste of the slightly funny deal
16.abstract: A system comprises one or more processors configured to execute instructions stored in non-transitory memory. The instructions when executed by the one or more processors are configured to cause the one or more processors to perform operations comprising obtaining data associated with a plurality of transactions; identifying at least one suspicious transaction from the plurality of transactions using a machine learning model that is trained to detect fraudulent transactions; analyzing the at least one suspicious transaction to determine whether the at least one suspicious transaction is indicative of money laundering; and if the at least one suspicious transaction is determined to be indicative of money laundering, flagging the at least one suspicious transaction as being related to money laundering.

17.content: A wasp shot from the nest and circled Case’s head. Case pressed the ignition switch, counted three, and pulled the trigger. The fuel, pumped up to l00 psi, sprayed out past the white-hot coil. A five-meter tongue of pale fire, the nest charring, tumbling.
17.title: Method and apparatus for exterminating wasps
17.abstract: A method of exterminating wasps includes providing a container having an opening, placing at least one wasp into the container through the opening, closing the opening to prevent additional wasps from entering the container, heating the contents of the container to a temperature sufficient to kill the at least one wasp, and releasing the pressure in the container after killing the at least one wasp. A device for exterminating wasps includes a container having an opening that can be closed to prevent additional wasps from entering the container, means for heating the contents of the container to a temperature sufficient to kill any wasps present in the container, and means for releasing the pressure in the container after killing the wasps.

18.content: The grip had been built up with layers of masking tape. The tape was old, brown, shiny with a patina of dirt. He flipped the cylinder out and examined each of the six cartridges. They were handloads.
18.title: Gunshot residue on a firearms examiner's glove
18.abstract: A method of analyzing gunshot residue (GSR) from a GSR-containing surface includes contacting the GSR-containing surface with a swab, wherein the swab comprises an absorbent material. The method also includes placing the swab in a container and adding a solvent to the container such that the solvent dissolves at least a portion of the GSR present on the swab. The method further includes removing the swab from the container and depositing the removed swab onto a microscope slide for analysis by scanning electron microscopy (SEM).

19.content: The low, vaulted hallway was lined with dozens of museum cases, archaic-looking glass-fronted boxes made of brown wood. They looked awkward there, against the organic curves of the hallway’s walls, as though they’d been brought in and set up in a line for some forgotten purpose. Dull brass fixtures held globes of white light at ten-meter intervals. The floor was uneven, and as she set off along the corridor, Case realized that hundreds of small rugs and carpets had been put down at random. In some places, they were six deep, the floor a soft patchwork of handwoven wool.
19.title: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for providing a museum of unnatural history
19.abstract: A method includes receiving an input from a user device. The method further includes determining that the input is associated with one or more artifacts stored in a data store. The method further includes retrieving the one or more artifacts from the data store. The method further includes transmitting the one or more artifacts to the user device. The method further includes presenting the one or more artifacts at the user device.

20.content: She returned his chip. An elevator slid open behind her. The corridor lights were blue. Case stepped out of the elevator and chose a direction at random. Numbered doors.
20.title: Case of the disappearing elevator, or, how I learned to stop worrying and love the elevator
20.abstract: A case for an elevator car is disclosed. The case includes a first sidewall extending between a first end and a second end opposite the first end; a second sidewall extending between the first end and the second end opposite the first end; a third sidewall extending between the first end and the second end opposite the first end; and a fourth sidewall extending between the first end and the second end opposite the first end. In some embodiments, at least one of the first sidewall, the second sidewall, the third sidewall, and the fourth sidewall are movable relative to another of the first sidewall, the second sidewall, the third sidewall, and the fourth sidewall.

21.content: “I want a cubicle,” he said to the girl who sat at the low desk, a terminal on her lap. “Lower level.” He handed her his chip. “Gender preference?” She passed the chip across a glass plate on the face of the terminal. “Female,” he said automatically. “Number thirty-five. Phone if it isn’t satisfactory. You can access our special services display beforehand, if you like.”
21.title: Method and apparatus for facilitating an interaction between a user and a cubicle
21.abstract: A method of providing information to a user is disclosed. The method includes detecting, by one or more sensors coupled to a computing device, that the user has entered a physical space proximate to the computing device; in response to detecting that the user has entered the physical space proximate to the computing device, identifying at least one application executing on the computing device; determining whether the identified at least one application is currently being utilized by the user; responsive to determining that the identified at least one application is not currently being utilized by the user, initiating execution of the identified at least one application such that the identified at least one application is available for use by the user while the user is within the physical space proximate to the computing device; and presenting data associated with the identified at least one application to the user. Corresponding apparatus, system, computer program products, and methods are also described.

22.content: Case stepped around the broad steel desk and pushed Deane’s chair out of the way. He found the gun in a cracked leather holster fastened beneath the desk with silver tape.
22.title: Method and apparatus for securing a firearm
22.abstract: A method of securing a firearm is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of: (a) providing a firearm, wherein the firearm includes a trigger guard; (b) inserting a finger into an opening in the trigger guard; (c) moving the finger toward a firing mechanism of the firearm through the opening in the trigger guard; (d) detecting that the finger has reached a first predetermined position relative to the opening in the trigger guard; and (e) preventing movement of the finger toward the firing mechanism of the firearm when the finger has reached the first predetermined position relative to the opening in the trigger guard. An apparatus for securing a firearm is also disclosed.

23.content: The Braun drone was perched on her shoulder, its tiny manipulators, like padded surgical clips, secure in the polycarbon of the Modern suit. The walls here were raw steel, striped with rough brown ribbons of epoxy where some kind of covering had been ripped away. She’d hidden from a work crew, crouching, the fletcher cradled in her hands, her suit steel-gray, while the two slender Africans and their balloon-tired workcart passed.
23.title: Methods, systems, and apparatuses for using drones, robots, and cyborgs in a post-apocalyptic world
23.abstract: A drone or robot may be programmed to perform one or more tasks. For example, the drone or robot may be programmed to search for survivors of a zombie apocalypse. The drone or robot may also be programmed to fight zombies when it encounters them. In addition, the drone or robot may be programmed to collect resources from the environment (e.g., food, water, fuel, etc.). Furthermore, the drone or robot may be programmed to communicate with other drones or robots so that they can coordinate their activities.

24.content: The expansion-grate catwalk vibrated with his weight as he edged his way along the third tier to Number 92. The coffins were three meters long, the oval hatches a meter wide and just under a meter and a half tall. He fed his key into the slot and waited for verification from the house computer. Magnetic bolts thudded reassuringly and the hatch rose vertically with a creak of springs. Fluorescents flickered on as he crawled in, pulling the hatch shut behind him and slapping the panel that activated the manual latch. There was nothing in Number 92 but a standard Hitachi pocket computer and a small white styrofoam cooler chest. The cooler contained the remains of three ten-kilo slabs of dry ice carefully wrapped in paper to delay evaporation, and a spun aluminum lab flask. Crouching on the brown temper foam slab that was both floor and bed, Case took Shin’s .22 from his pocket and put it on top of the cooler. Then he took off his jacket. The coffin’s terminal was molded into one concave wall, opposite a panel listing house rules in seven languages. Case took the pink handset from its cradle and punched a Hongkong number from memory.
24.title: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer storage medium, for dead man's dilemma; or, how I learned to stop worrying and love the zombie apocalypse. In accord
24.abstract: A method of treating an infection includes administering at least one dose of a therapeutically effective amount of a pharmaceutical composition comprising (a) about 0.1 mg/ml to about 50 mg/ml of amphotericin B lipid complexed with -D-erythro-trehalose monohydrate dissolved in propylene glycol carboxylic acid ethyl ester (PGEE), wherein the PGEE is present in an amount from about 2% w/v to about 30% w/v relative to the total volume of the pharmaceutical composition; (b) about 0.1 mg/ml to about 50 mg/ml of voriconazole dissolved in PGEE, wherein the PGEE is present in an amount from about 2% w/

25.content: The third, which was deeper, contained dull beads of solder and a small brown thing that looked like a human fingerbone. The fourth drawer held a damp-swollen copy of an obsolete technical manual in French and Japanese. In the fifth, behind the armored gauntlet of a heavy vacuum suit, she found the key. It was like a dull brass coin with a short hollow tube braised against one edge. She turned it slowly in her hand and Case saw that the interior of the tube was lined with studs and flanges. The letters CHUBB were molded across one face of the coin.
25.title: Safe deposit box key
25.abstract: A safe deposit box key is provided. The safe deposit box key includes a body portion and a head portion coupled to the body portion at a first end of the body portion. A second end of the body portion opposite the first end extends from the head portion in a direction substantially perpendicular to an axis of rotation of the head portion relative to the body portion.

26.content: Case noticed the music then. A music he didn’t know, all horns and piano.
26.title: Method and apparatus for determining whether a user is listening to music
26.abstract: A method of determining whether a user is listening to music includes receiving, by an electronic device, at least one audio signal from a microphone of the electronic device. The method also includes analyzing, by processing circuitry of the electronic device, the at least one audio signal to determine if the at least one audio signal comprises background noise that exceeds a predetermined threshold. The method further includes in response to determining that the at least one audio signal does not comprise background noise that exceeds the predetermined threshold, outputting, by the electronic device, a first indication indicating that the user is listening to music via the electronic device; and in response to determining that the at least one audio signal comprises background noise that exceeds the predetermined threshold, outputting, by the electronic device, a second indication indicating that the user is not listening to music via the electronic device.

27.content: Drunk, Case rummaged in the sour closet for Rollo’s dragon. Rollo was Marlene’s previous—and, Case suspected at the time, still occasional—boyfriend, an enormous Frisco biker with a blond lightning bolt bleached into his dark crewcut. The dragon was a Frisco flamethrower, a thing like a fat anglehead flashlight. Case checked the batteries, shook it to make sure he had enough fuel, and went to the open window. The hive began to buzz.
27.title: Apparatus and method for locating a missing dragon
27.abstract: To locate a missing person, such as a child or pet, an apparatus is provided. The apparatus includes at least one transmitter that transmits a first radio frequency (RF) signal having a predetermined RF wavelength in the form of a chirped pulse waveform to generate a plurality of time-varying electromagnetic pulses over a period of time. At least one receiver receives each of the plurality of time-varying electromagnetic pulses generated by the at least one transmitter. Each of the plurality of time-varying electromagnetic pulses received by the at least one receiver has a different phase from another of the plurality of time-varying electromagnetic pulses received by the at least one receiver. A processor determines whether any of the plurality of time-varying electromagnetic pulses received by

28.content: They came to another monitor, an antique Sony, this one mounted above a console with a keyboard and a complex array of jack panels. The screen lit as they halted, the Finn grinning tensely out at them from what seemed to be the front room of Metro Holografix. “Okay,” he said, “Maelcum takes this guy down the corridor to the open locker door, sticks him in there, I’ll lock it. Case, you want the fifth socket from the left, top panel. There’s adapter plugs in the cabinet under the console. Needs Ono-Sendai twenty-point into Hitachi forty.” As Maelcum nudged his captive along, Case knelt and fumbled through an assortment of plugs, finally coming up with the one he needed. With his deck jacked into the adapter, he paused. “Do you have to look like that, man?” he asked the face on the screen. The Finn was erased a line at a time by the image of Lonny Zone against a wall of peeling Japanese posters.
28.title: Method and apparatus for providing a holographic user interface
28.abstract: A method of controlling an augmented reality device comprises detecting, by one or more sensors associated with the augmented reality device, movement of the augmented reality device. The method further comprises determining, in response to detecting the movement of the augmented reality device, that the augmented reality device has transitioned from a first orientation to a second orientation different than the first orientation. The method further comprises adjusting, in response to determining that the augmented reality device has transitioned from the first orientation to the second orientation, at least one aspect of a three-dimensional (3D) virtual environment presented by the augmented reality device such that the at least one aspect of the 3D virtual environment is aligned with the second orientation of the augmented reality device.

29.content: She closed her eyes and there was a click that Case felt rather than heard. It made him remember the magnetic locks on the door of her cubicle in the puppet place. The door had opened for him, even though he’d had the wrong chip. That was Wintermute, manipulating the lock the way it had manipulated the drone micro and the robot gardener. The lock system in the puppet place had been a subunit of Freeside’s security system. The simple mechanical lock here would pose a real problem for the AI, requiring either a drone of some kind or a human agent. She opened her eyes, put the pick back into the chamois, carefully rerolled it, and tucked it back into its pocket.
29.title: Method and apparatus for securing a lock
29.abstract: A method of securing a lock is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of: (a) providing an electronic key; (b) transmitting, from the electronic key to a transceiver associated with the lock, data indicative of at least one feature of the electronic key; (c) receiving, at the transceiver, the data indicative of the at least one feature of the electronic key; (d) determining whether or not the received data indicates that the electronic key is authorised to operate the lock; and (e) operating the lock when it is determined in step (d) that the electronic key is authorised to operate the lock. An apparatus for securing a lock is also disclosed.

30.content: “I want to know about the implants,” she said, massaging her thigh, “I want to know exactly what he can do.” Terzibashjian nodded. “Worst is how you say in Ingiliz, the subliminals.” He made the word four careful syllables. “On our left,” said the Mercedes, as it steered through a maze of rainy streets, “is Kapali Carsi, the grand bazaar.” Beside Case, the Finn made an appreciative noise, but he was looking in the wrong direction. The right side of the street was lined with miniature scrapyards. Case saw a gutted locomotive atop rust-stained, broken lengths of fluted marble.
30.title: Techno-fetishism and transhumanism in William Gibson's Neuromancer (1984), Count Zero (1986), and Mona Lisa Overdrive (1988)
30.abstract: This dissertation is an interdisciplinary study of the cyberpunk novels Neuromancer (1984), Count Zero (1986), and Mona Lisa Overdrive (1988) by American science fiction author William Gibson. It argues that these three novels can be understood as explorations of techno-fetishism and transhumanism, two phenomena which have become increasingly prevalent over the past few decades due to advancements in digital technology. Techno-fetishism refers to our society's tendency to fetishize new technologies while ignoring their potential negative consequences; transhumanism refers to humanity's quest for immortality through scientific means such as genetic engineering or uploading one's consciousness into a computer system. By examining how these themes are depicted in Gibson's work, this dissertation

31.content: While he watched the loser’s zodiac of Freeside, the nightclub constellations of the hologram sky, shift, sliding fluid down the axis of darkness, to swarm like live things at the dead center of reality. Until they had arranged themselves, individually and in their hundreds, to form a vast simple portrait, stippled the ultimate monochrome, stars against night sky. Face of Miss Linda Lee. When he was able to look away, to lower his eyes, he found every other face in the street upraised, the strolling tourists becalmed with wonder.
31.title: Method and apparatus for generating a holographic display
31.abstract: A method of generating a holographic image comprises the steps of: (a) capturing an image; (b) processing the captured image to generate a plurality of depth maps, wherein each depth map is associated with a respective one of a plurality of planes in three-dimensional space; (c) determining at least one point cloud from the plurality of depth maps; (d) extracting features from the at least one point cloud; (e) classifying the extracted features into predetermined classes using a machine learning algorithm; (f) identifying points within the at least one point cloud that are common to two or more of the predetermined classes; (g) removing the identified points from the at least one point cloud; and (h) reconstructing the holographic image.

32.title: Systems and methods for secure access to an electronic device
32.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for providing secure access to an electronic device. In one implementation, a method is performed at an electronic device with one or more processors executing one or more programs stored in a non-transitory memory, the method including receiving, by the electronic device from a user via a graphical user interface (GUI), biometric information associated with the user; comparing, by the electronic device, the received biometric information against pre-stored biometric information corresponding to the user; determining, by the electronic device, that the received biometric information matches the pre-stored biometric information; responsive to determining that the received biometric information matches the pre-stored biometric information, authenticating, by the electronic device, the user as having authorized access to the electronic device; and unlocking, by the electronic device, a display screen of the electronic device.

33.content: Found the ridged face of the power stud. And in the bloodlit dark behind his eyes, silver phosphenes boiling in from the edge of space, hypnagogic images jerking past like film compiled from random frames. Symbols, figures, faces, a blurred, fragmented mandala of visual information. Please, he prayed, now— A gray disk, the color of Chiba sky. Now— Disk beginning to rotate, faster, becoming a sphere of paler gray. Expanding— And flowed, flowered for him, fluid neon origami trick, the unfolding of his distance less home, his country, transparent 3D chessboard extending to infinity. Inner eye opening to the stepped scarlet pyramid of the Eastern Seaboard Fission Authority burning beyond the green cubes of Mitsubishi Bank of America, and high and very far away he saw the spiral arms of military systems, forever beyond his reach. And somewhere he was laughing, in a white-painted loft, distant fingers caressing the deck, tears of release streaking his face.
33.title: Apparatus and method for detecting a power stud in an electrical outlet
33.abstract: A device, system and method for detecting the presence of a power stud in an electrical outlet are disclosed. An exemplary embodiment includes a circuit board having a plurality of conductive pads formed thereon; at least one capacitive proximity sensor coupled to the circuit board wherein the at least one capacitive proximity sensor is configured to generate a signal indicative of its proximity to any of the plurality of conductive pads when positioned within a predetermined distance from each of the plurality of conductive pads; and a processor communicatively coupled to the at least one capacitive proximity sensor wherein the processor is configured to receive the signal generated by the at least one capacitive proximity sensor and determine whether or not a power stud is present in the electrical outlet based on the signal received from the at least one capacitive proximity sensor. Various other aspects are contemplated.

34.content: And then, his face pink with the pleasure of cocaine and meperidine, he swung the glass hard into her left lens implant, smashing vision into blood and light. Maelcum was prone against the cabin ceiling when Case removed the trodes. A nylon sling around his waist was fastened to the panels on either side with shock cords and gray rubber suction pads. He had his shirt off and was working on a central panel with a clumsy-looking zero-g wrench, the thing’s fat countersprings twanging as he removed another hexhead. Marcus Garvey was groaning and ticking with g-stress. “The Mute takin’ I an’ I dock,” the Zionite said, popping the hexhead into a mesh pouch at his waist. “Maelcum pilot th’ landin’, meantime need we tool f’ th’ job.”
34.title: Method and apparatus for repairing a damaged or defective lens implant in a patient's eye
34.abstract: A method of repairing a damaged or defective lens implant in a patient's eye includes inserting an insertion tube into the eye. The insertion tube has a distal end that is disposed adjacent to the damaged or defective lens implant. A cutting tool is inserted through the insertion tube so that the cutting tool extends beyond the distal end of the insertion tube. The cutting tool is used to remove at least a portion of the damaged or defective lens implant from the eye. An aspiration device is inserted through the insertion tube so that the aspiration device extends beyond the distal end of the insertion tube. The aspiration device is used to suction fluid out of the eye.

35.content: Wood grated on stone or concrete. Ten meters down the alley, a wedge of yellow light fell across wet cobbles, widened. A figure stepped out and the door grated shut again, leaving the narrow place in darkness. Case shivered. “Now,” Terzibashjian said, and a brilliant beam of white light, directed from the rooftop of the building opposite the market, pinned the slender figure beside the ancient wooden door in a perfect circle.
35.title: Method and apparatus for illuminating a subject with a plurality of beams of light emanating from a plurality of light sources
35.abstract: A method (100) is disclosed for illuminating a subject. The method comprises the steps of: projecting at least one beam of light onto the subject, wherein the at least one beam of light has a first wavelength; capturing an image of the subject in response to the projection of the at least one beam of light having the first wavelength; determining whether the captured image satisfies a predetermined criterion; if it is determined that the captured image satisfies the predetermined criterion, projecting another beam of light onto the subject, wherein the another beam of light has a second wavelength different from the first wavelength; and capturing an image of the subject in response to the projection of the another beam of light having the second wavelength.

36.content: He stepped out into the courtyard that served the place as some combination of lobby and lawn. Centered in the square carpet of green plastic turf, a Japanese teenager sat behind a C-shaped console, reading a textbook. The white fiberglass coffins were racked in a framework of industrial scaffolding. Six tiers of coffins, ten coffins on a side. Case nodded in the boy’s direction and limped across the plastic grass to the nearest ladder.

36.abstract: A method of preparing a body for burial or cremation includes the steps of (a) providing a container having an interior space; (b) placing the body in the interior space of the container; (c) introducing into the interior space of the container at least one fluid, wherein the at least one fluid is selected from the group consisting of hydrogen peroxide, sodium hypochlorite, potassium permanganate, chlorine dioxide, ozone, ultraviolet light radiation, calcium hypochlorite, bromine, iodine, formaldehyde, glutaraldehyde, paraformaldehyde, methylene chloride, trichloroethylene, tetrachloroethylene, carbon tetrachloride, benzalkonium chloride, quaternary ammonium

37.content: She stood up, favoring her left leg, and watched the little drone reverse. It picked its methodical way back across its girder and into darkness. She turned and looked back at the service area. The man in the orange jumpsuit was sealing the front of a white vacuum rig. She watched him ring and seal the helmet, pick up his console, and step back through the gap in the construction boat’s hull. There was a rising whine of motors and the thing slid smoothly out of sight on a ten-meter circle of flooring that sank away into a harsh glare of arc lamps. The red drone waited patiently at the edge of the hole left by the elevator panel. Then she was off after the Braun, threading her way between a forest of welded steel struts. The Braun winked its LED steadily, beckoning her on. “How you doin’, Case?
37.title: Method and apparatus for cleaning debris from a surface of a body of water using an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV)
37.abstract: A method, system, and apparatus are disclosed for cleaning debris from a surface of a body of water using an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV). In one embodiment, the method comprises providing a UAV that is configured to be launched into the body of water; launching the UAV into the body of water; flying the UAV over the surface of the body of water at a predetermined altitude above the surface of the body of water such that the UAV collects debris from the surface of the body of water as the UAV flies over the surface of the body of water; and landing the UAV in the body of water when the UAV has collected a desired amount of debris from the surface of the body of water.

38.content: The gate blurred past. He laughed. The Sense/Net ice had accepted his entry as a routine transfer from the consortium’s Los Angeles complex. He was inside. Behind him, viral sub-programs peeled off, meshing with the gate’ s code fabric, ready to deflect the real Los Angeles data when it arrived. He flipped again. Molly was strolling past the enormous circular reception desk at the rear of the lobby. 12:01:20 as the readout flared in her optic nerve. At midnight, synched with the chip behind Molly’s eye, the link man in Jersey had given his command. “Mainline.” Nine Moderns, scattered along two hundred miles of the Sprawl, had simultaneously dialed MAX EMERG from pay phones. Each Modern delivered a short set speech, hung up, and drifted out into the night, peeling off surgical gloves. Nine different police departments and public security agencies were absorbing the information that an obscure sub sect of militant Christian fundamentalists had just taken credit for having introduced clinical levels of an outlawed psychoactive agent known as Blue Nine into the ventilation system of the Sense/Net Pyramid.
38.title: Gate blurred past
38.abstract: A method of processing an image, the method comprising: receiving an input image; determining one or more regions of interest (ROI) within the input image; for each ROI in the plurality of ROIs, extracting at least one feature from the respective ROI to generate a set of features associated with that ROI; training a machine learning model using the set of features and ground-truth information relating to corresponding portions of the input image so as to produce a trained machine learning model; applying the trained machine learning model to determine a confidence score for each ROI; wherein if the confidence score is greater than a predetermined threshold then outputting the portion of the input image corresponding to the ROI otherwise discarding the portion of the input image corresponding to the ROI.

39.content: The white.” Case jacked out. Maelcum was hunched over Garvey’s controls, tapping out commands for a docking sequence. The module’s central screen displayed a fixed red square that represented the Straylight dock. Garvey was a larger square, green, that shrank slowly, wavering from side to side with Maelcum’s commands. To the left, a smaller screen displayed a skeletal graphic of Garvey and Haniwa as they approached the curvature of the spindle. “We got an hour, man,” Case said, pulling the ribbon of fiberoptics from the Hosaka. His deck’s backup batteries were good for ninety minutes, but the Flatline’s construct would be an additional drain. He worked quickly, mechanically, fastening the construct to the bottom of the Ono-Sendai with micro-pore tape. Maelcum’s workbelt drifted past. He snagged it, unclipped the two lengths of shock cord, with their gray rectangular suction pads, and hooked the jaws of one clip through the other. He held the pads against the sides of his deck and worked the thumb lever that created suction. With the deck, construct, and improvised shoulder strap suspended in front of him, he struggled into his leather jacket, checking the contents of his pockets. The passport Armitage had given him, the bank chip in the same name, the credit chip he’d been issued when he’d entered Freeside, two derms of the Betaphenethylamine he’d bought from Bruce, a roll of New Yen, half a pack of Yeheyuans, and the shuriken. He tossed the Freeside chip over his shoulders, heard it click off the Russian scrubber.
39.title: Method and apparatus for docking a spacecraft
39.abstract: A method of controlling a spacecraft includes receiving, by a processor coupled to an inertial measurement unit (IMU), sensor data from at least one sensor associated with the spacecraft. The sensor data is indicative of movement of the spacecraft relative to a reference frame. The method further includes determining that the IMU has not been calibrated within a predetermined period of time using the sensor data. In response to determining that the IMU has not been calibrated within the predetermined period of time, the method also includes transmitting a command to activate a plurality of thrusters of the spacecraft such that the spacecraft docks with another spacecraft.

40.content: Case felt like laughing. He could feel the micro pore tape across her ribcage, feel the flat little units under it: the radio, the Simstim unit, and the scrambler. The throat mike, glued to her neck, looked as much as possible like an analgesic dermadisk. Her hands, in the pockets of the pink coat, were flexing systematically through a series of tension-release exercises. It took him a few seconds to realize that the peculiar sensation at the tips of her fingers was caused by the blades as they were partially extruded, then retracted. He flipped back. His program had reached the fifth gate. He watched as his icebreaker strobed and shifted in front of him, only faintly aware of his hands playing across the deck, making minor adjustments. Translucent planes of color shuffled like a trick deck.
40.title: Method and apparatus for extracting information from a subject's subconscious during hypnosis
40.abstract: A method of extracting information from a subject's subconscious during hypnosis is provided. The method comprises the steps of (a) providing an audio signal to induce hypnosis in the subject, wherein the audio signal includes one or more auditory stimuli; (b) measuring at least one physiological parameter associated with the subject while the subject is undergoing hypnosis induced by the audio signal; and (c) analyzing the at least one physiological parameter measured in step (b).

41.content: Case punched for the Swiss banking sector, feeling a wave of exhilaration as cyberspace shivered, blurred, gelled. The Eastern Seaboard Fission Authority was gone, replaced by the cool geometric intricacy of Zurich commercial banking. He punched again, for Berne. “Up,” the construct said.
41.title: Systems and methods for managing financial transactions
41.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for facilitating electronic payments. In one implementation, a method is performed by at least one computing system that includes receiving, from a first user device associated with a first user, a request to initiate an electronic payment transaction between the first user and a second user; determining whether the first user has been previously identified as a fraudulent user; in response to determining that the first user has not been previously identified as a fraudulent user, transmitting instructions to a second user device associated with the second user instructing the second user device to enable initiation of the electronic payment transaction between the first user and the second user; enabling initiation of the electronic payment transaction between the first user and the second user; and processing the electronic payment transaction between the first user and the second user. Various other implementations are also contemplated.

42.content: The scorpion swayed its brownish claws and scurried up his arm, its feet tracking the faint dark telltales of veins. When it reached the inner elbow, it halted and seemed to vibrate. Riviera made a soft hissing sound. The sting came up, quivered, and sank into the skin above a bulging vein. The coral snake relaxed, and Riviera sighed slowly as the injection hit him. Then the snake and the scorpion were gone, and he held a milky plastic syringe in his left hand.
42.title: Method and apparatus for administering an injectable pharmaceutical
42.abstract: A method of treating pain in a patient comprising the steps of providing a syringe having a plunger movably disposed therein between a first position and a second position, wherein at least a portion of the plunger is coated with a therapeutically effective dose of opioid analgesic; moving the plunger from the first position to the second position so as to withdraw a volume of saline into the syringe equal to or greater than the volume of the therapeutically effective dose of opioid analgesic; and releasing the plunger from the second position so as to permit movement of the plunger toward the first position thereby permitting injection of the therapeutically effective dose of opioid analgesic into the patient.

43.title: Systems and methods for detecting suicidality in a user of an augmented reality head-mounted display (AR-HMD)
43.abstract: A system may include one or more processors configured to execute instructions that cause the system to perform operations. The operations may include obtaining, using at least one sensor associated with an augmented reality head-mounted display (AR-HMD), physiological data corresponding to a user of the AR-HMD; determining, based on the physiological data obtained by the at least one sensor, whether the user is likely to commit suicide within a predetermined period of time; and presenting, responsive to determining that the user is likely to commit suicide within the predetermined period of time, information indicating that the user is likely to commit suicide within the predetermined period of time. Other embodiments are described herein.

44.title: Apparatus and method for controlling access to a secure area
44.abstract: A system, apparatus, and method are disclosed for controlling access to a secure area. In one embodiment, an apparatus is provided that comprises at least one sensor configured to detect the presence or absence of a first object within a predetermined proximity of the apparatus; wherein the apparatus is configured to control access to a secure area in response to detection by the at least one sensor of the presence or absence of the first object within the predetermined proximity of the apparatus. The apparatus may further comprise a second sensor configured to detect the presence or absence of a second object within a predetermined proximity of the apparatus; wherein the apparatus is configured to control access to the secure area in response to detection by the second sensor of the presence or absence of the second object within the predetermined proximity of the apparatus. A razor, etched in red as a third beam blinked past them into the dark. Case saw the razor dipping for his throat like a dowser’s wand. The face was erased in a humming cloud of microscopic explosions.
46.title: Method and apparatus for removing tissue
46.abstract: A method of treating an area in a patient includes positioning at least one ultrasound transducer adjacent to the area. The method further includes transmitting, by the at least one ultrasound transducer, pulses of ultrasound energy into the area while simultaneously receiving reflections of the pulse of ultrasound energy from the area with the at least one ultrasound transducer.

47.title: Method and apparatus for cloning organisms
47.abstract: A method of cloning an organism is provided. The method includes obtaining nucleic acids from the organism, wherein the nucleic acids comprise at least one endonuclease-resistant target site; introducing into the organism a recombinant polynucleotide that hybridizes to the at least one endonuclease-resistant target site such that the recombinant polynucleotide overlaps the at least one endonuclease-resistant target site; exposing the organism having the recombinant polynucleotide to an endonuclease under conditions effective to produce double strand breaks in the genome of the organism; and repairing the double strand breaks by homologous recombination between the recombinant polynucleotide and regions of the genome of the organism flanking the at least one endonuclease

48.content: Case gulped the last of his coffee, settled the trodes in place, and scratched his chest beneath his black t-shirt. He had only a vague idea of what the Panther Moderns planned as a diversion for the Sense/Net security people. His job was to make sure the intrusion program he’d written would link with the Sense/Net systems when Molly needed it to. He watched the countdown in the corner of the screen. Two. One. He jacked in and triggered his program. “Mainline,” breathed the link man, his voice the only sound as Case plunged through the glowing strata of Sense/Net ice.
48.title: Systems and methods for secure communications over a public switched telephone network (PSTN) or internet protocol (IP) network
48.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for securing communications. In one implementation, a method includes receiving an incoming call from a calling party via a Public Switched Telephone Network (PSTN), wherein the PSTN is in communication with at least one Internet Protocol (IP) network. The method further includes determining whether the calling party is authorized to communicate with a user device associated with a Private Branch Exchange (PBX). Responsive to determining that the calling party is not authorized to communicate with the user device associated with the PBX, the method also includes rejecting the incoming call without forwarding the incoming call to the user device associated with the PBX. Otherwise, the method includes forwarding the incoming call to the user device associated with the PBX.

49.content: Turing? “Came before?” Case climbed into the scooter’s frame and began to fasten the straps. “Japan yacht. Brought you package…” Armitage. Confused images of wasps and spiders rose in Case’s mind as they came in sight of Marcus Garvey. The little tug was snug against the gray thorax of a sleek, insectile ship five times her length. The arms of grapples stood out against Garvey’s patched hull with the strange clarity of vacuum and raw sunlight. A pale corrugated gangway curved out of the yacht, snaked sideways to avoid the tug’s engines, and covered the aft hatch. There was something obscene about the arrangement, but it had more to do with ideas of feeding than of sex.
49.title: Method and apparatus for transferring cargo from a tugboat to a yacht
49.abstract: A method of transferring cargo from a tugboat to a yacht includes receiving, by a control system, an indication that the tugboat is in proximity to the yacht. The method also includes determining, by the control system, one or more parameters associated with the tugboat and/or the yacht. The method further includes transmitting, by the control system, information related to the one or more parameters to the tugboat such that the tugboat transfers cargo from the tugboat to the yacht according to the determined one or more parameters. Additionally, the method includes controlling, by the control system, movement of the tugboat relative to the yacht as the tugboat transfers cargo from the tugboat to the yacht. Further, the method includes monitoring, by the control system, at least one parameter while the tugboat transfers cargo from the t

50.content: The library’s central bank suffered a minute shift in its permanent memory: the construct had been removed, per executive order, a month before. Checking for the authorization to remove the construct, a librarian would find the records erased.
50.title: Systems and methods for detecting unauthorized deletion of genetic constructs from a library of genetically modified organisms (GMOs)
50.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure provide systems and methods for detecting unauthorized deletion of genetic constructs from a library of genetically modified organisms (GMOs). In one implementation, an example method may include obtaining sequence information associated with a plurality of nucleic acid molecules in a library of GMOs; storing the sequence information in a database; determining that at least some of the nucleic acid molecules have been deleted from the library of GMOs; comparing the sequence information stored in the database to sequence information obtained from biomass derived from the library of GMOs; and identifying contamination events within the library of GMOs.

51.title: Method and apparatus for securely storing and retrieving cryptographic keys in a non-volatile memory (NVM) of an integrated circuit (IC)
51.abstract: A method includes receiving, by a processor from a host device, a request to store one or more encrypted data units. Each encrypted data unit is associated with at least one unencrypted data unit corresponding to the encrypted data unit. The method further includes performing, by the processor, a decryption operation using a private key stored in a trusted execution environment (TEE), wherein the decryption operation transforms each encrypted data unit into its corresponding unencrypted data unit. The method further includes writing, by the processor, the plurality of unencrypted data units to a non-volatile memory (NVM). In addition, the method includes transmitting, by the processor, acknowledgement information to the host device indicating successful storage of the plurality of unencrypted data units in the NVM. Further, the method includes erasing, by the processor, the plurality of unencrypted data units from the NVM after a predetermined time

52.title: Method and apparatus for identifying a user in an emergency situation
52.abstract: A method of identifying a user in an emergency situation includes receiving, by a computing device, biometric data from a sensor associated with the computing device; determining, by the computing device, whether the received biometric data corresponds to one or more pre-stored sets of biometric data corresponding to at least one authorized user. In response to determining that the received biometric data does not correspond to any of the one or more pre-stored sets of biometric data, the method further includes transmitting, by the computing device, instructions to initiate an emergency procedure via a communications interface coupled to the computing device.

53.title: Method and apparatus for detecting and responding to computer viruses
53.abstract: A method of detecting an unauthorized software program in a computing device is disclosed. The method includes receiving, at the computing device, a plurality of data packets from one or more devices connected to the computing device via a network; determining whether any of the plurality of data packets comprise malicious code by analyzing each of the plurality of data packets using a first set of rules stored in memory associated with the computing device; responsive to determining that none of the plurality of data packets comprise malicious code, permitting communication between the computing device and the one or more devices over the network; and responsive to determining that at least one of the plurality of data packets comprises malicious code, preventing communication between the computing device and the one or more devices over the network.

Later on you said you wouldn’t exist, if the run goes off and Molly gets the word into the right slot.” The Finn’s streamlined skull nodded. “Okay, then who we gonna be dealing with then?
54.title: Cyberpunk 2077: art of the game
54.abstract: A method for generating an augmented reality (AR) experience is provided. The method includes obtaining, by one or more processors, image data from at least one camera; determining, by the one or more processors, depth information associated with the image data; detecting, by the one or more processors, objects in the image data using the depth information; classifying, by the one or more processors, the detected objects into one or more categories; and overlaying, by the one or more processors, virtual content onto the image data based on the classification of the detected objects.

55.content: Maelcum kicked off and drifted past the pilot console, busying himself with a caulk gun. Case hastily looked away from the waving fronds of transparent caulk.
55.title: Method and apparatus for repairing a damaged hull of a spacecraft
55.abstract: A method is provided for repairing a damaged hull of a spacecraft. The method includes detecting, by one or more sensors associated with the spacecraft, at least one damage to the hull of the spacecraft; determining that the at least one damage exceeds a predetermined threshold value; transmitting an alert signal indicating that the at least one damage exceeds the predetermined threshold value; receiving instructions from a ground-based control system via a communication link between the spacecraft and the ground-based control system; and applying the instructions received from the ground-based control system to repair the at least one damage in the hull of the spacecraft.

56.title: Apparatus and method for creating a personalized avatar
56.abstract: A system, apparatus, and method are disclosed for creating a personalized avatar. In one embodiment, the invention provides a computer-implemented method of creating a personalized avatar comprising receiving an input from a user to create a personalized avatar; obtaining at least one image associated with the user; processing the at least one image into a plurality of feature points; generating a three-dimensional (3D) model using the plurality of feature points; modifying the 3D model to generate a modified 3D model wherein the modified 3D model is customizable by the user; presenting the modified 3D model to the user via a graphical user interface such that the user can selectively modify features of the modified 3D model; and storing the modified 3D model when the user accepts the modified 3D model.

57.content: “The matrix has its roots in primitive arcade games,” said the voice-over, “in early graphics programs and military experimentation with cranial jacks.” On the Sony, a two-dimensional space war faded behind a forest of mathematically generated ferns, demonstrating the spatial possibilities of logarithmic spirals—cold blue military footage burned through, lab animals wired into test systems, helmets feeding into fire control circuits of tanks and war planes. “Cyberspace. A consensual hallucination experienced daily by billions of legitimate operators, in every nation, by children being taught mathematical concepts… A graphic representation of data abstracted from the banks of every computer in the human system. Unthinkable complexity. Lines of light ranged in the non space of the mind, clusters and constellations of data. Like city lights, receding…” “What’s that?” Molly asked, as he flipped the channel selector. “Kid’s show.” A discontinuous flood of images as the selector cycled.
57.title: Method and apparatus for enhancing a user's immersion in a virtual reality environment
57.abstract: A method of providing an augmented reality experience to a user is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of: (i) determining, by one or more processors associated with at least one head-mounted device worn by the user, that the user is wearing the at least one head-mounted device; (ii) obtaining, by the one or more processors, data indicative of eye movements of the user while the user is wearing the at least one head-mounted device; (iii) analyzing, by the one or more processors, the data obtained in step (ii); and (iv) controlling, by the one or more processors, delivery of content to the user via the at least one head-mounted device responsive to the analysis performed in step (iii).

58.content: Case punched to within four grid points of the cube. Its blank face, towering above him now, began to seethe with faint internal shadows, as though a thousand dancers whirled behind a vast sheet of frosted glass. “Knows we’re here,” the Flatline observed. Case punched again, once; they jumped forward by a single grid point. A stippled gray circle formed on the face of the cube.
58.title: Method and apparatus for detecting an object in a field of view of a head-mounted display (HMD)
58.abstract: A method is provided for detecting an object in a field of view of a head-mounted display (HMD). The method includes receiving, by the HMD, one or more sensor signals from one or more sensors associated with the HMD. At least some of the one or more sensor signals are indicative of objects within the field of view of the HMD. The method further includes determining, by the HMD, whether at least one predetermined condition has been satisfied. In response to determining that the at least one predetermined condition has been satisfied, the method includes transmitting, by the HMD, a notification message to a computing device coupled to the HMD. The notification message comprises information relating to detected objects within the field of view of the HMD. Corresponding apparatus, systems, computers program products, and methods are also described herein.

59.title: Apparatus and method for projecting a three-dimensional (3D) object onto a two-dimensional (2D) surface
59.abstract: An apparatus includes a light source, a lens system, an image sensor, and a processor. The light source is configured to emit at least one beam of light toward the lens system. The lens system is configured to receive the at least one beam of light from the light source and focus the at least one beam of light into multiple beams of collimated light. The image sensor is configured to receive the multiple beams of collimated light focused by the lens system and convert the received multiple beams of collimated light into electrical signals. The processor is configured to process the electrical signals generated by the image sensor in order to determine positional information corresponding to each of the multiple beams of collimated light as well as depth information corresponding to each of the multiple beams of collimated light.

63.title: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for detecting and responding to intruders
63.abstract: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for detecting and responding to intruders are disclosed. In one embodiment, the method comprises obtaining an image of a scene; determining that at least one object in the image is moving with respect to other objects in the image; identifying movement characteristics associated with the at least one object; comparing the identified movement characteristics against predetermined behavioral patterns corresponding to different types of intruders; classifying the at least one object as belonging to one of the different types of intruders when the comparison indicates a match between the identified movement characteristics and each of the predetermined behavioral patterns; and responsive to classifying the at least one object as belonging to one of the different types of intruders, transmitting data indicative of the classification to a remote computing device.

64.content: Two blocks later, she was threading the outskirts of Memory Lane. Case kept trying to jerk her eyes toward landmarks he would have used to find his way. He began to find the passivity of the situation irritating. The transition to cyberspace, when he hit the switch, was instantaneous. He punched himself down a wall of primitive ice belonging to the New York Public Library, automatically counting potential windows. Keying back into her sensorium, into the sinuous flow of muscle, senses sharp and bright. He found himself wondering about the mind he shared these sensations with. What did he know about her? That she was another professional; that she said her being, like his, was the thing she did to make a living. He knew the way she’d moved against him, earlier, when she woke, their mutual grunt of unity when he’d entered her, and that she liked her coffee black, afterward… Her destination was one of the dubious software rental complexes that lined Memory Lane. There was a stillness, a hush. Booths lined a central hall.
64.title: Augmented reality cyberpunk detective thriller
64.abstract: An augmented reality cyberpunk detective thriller is provided. The augmented reality cyberpunk detective thriller may be configured to provide an immersive and interactive experience for players, allowing them to explore a virtual world while solving puzzles and completing missions. The augmented reality cyberpunk detective thriller may use cutting-edge technologies such as virtual reality (VR), augmented reality (AR), artificial intelligence (AI), and blockchain technology to create a unique and engaging gaming experience. By combining these technologies, the augmented reality cyberpunk detective thriller may allow players to interact with the virtual world in new and exciting ways, making it stand out from other games in the market.

The security package taped to the steel fire door bleeped twice. “Entry requested,” it said. “Subject is cleared per my program.” “So open it.” Case pulled the silk from his face and sat up as the door opened, expecting to see Molly or Armitage.

Neon worms writhing in her thigh, the touch of burlap, smell of frying krill—his mind recoiled from it. If he avoided focusing on it, the impressions overlapped, became a sensory equivalent of white noise.
66.title: Method and apparatus for treating chronic pain
66.abstract: A method of treating chronic pain includes administering to a patient in need thereof an effective amount of at least one cannabinoid receptor type 1 (CB1) agonist, wherein the CB1 agonist is selected from the group consisting of tetrahydrocannabinol (THC), cannabidiol (CBD), or a pharmaceutically acceptable salt, prodrug, stereoisomer, or derivative thereof; and administering to the patient in need thereof an effective amount of at least one cannabinoid receptor type 2 (CB2) agonist, wherein the CB2 agonist is selected from the group consisting of THC, CBD, or a pharmaceutically acceptable salt, prodrug, stereoisomer, or derivative thereof.

67.title: Method and apparatus for detecting unauthorized access to a computing device
67.abstract: A method of detecting unauthorized access to a computing device is disclosed. In one embodiment, the method comprises receiving an input from a sensor associated with the computing device; determining whether the input satisfies a predetermined criterion; in response to determining that the input satisfies the predetermined criterion, identifying at least one suspicious event occurring within a predefined time period prior to receipt of the input by the sensor; classifying the input as authorized or unauthorized using machine learning techniques; if the input is classified as unauthorized, preventing execution of instructions corresponding to the input; otherwise, permitting execution of the instructions corresponding to the input.

68.title: Augmented reality gambling system and method
68.abstract: An augmented reality (AR) gaming system includes an AR head-mounted display device configured to be worn by a user, the AR head-mounted display device including at least one camera that captures images of a real-world environment in which the user is located. An AR controller communicatively coupled to the AR head-mounted display device controls operation of the AR head-mounted display device. The AR controller receives image data captured by the at least one camera included in the AR head-mounted display device while the user wears the AR head-mounted display device within the real-world environment. The AR controller processes the image data received from the at least one camera to identify objects depicted in the image data. The AR controller determines whether any of the identified objects corresponds to a game object associated with a wagering game being played by the user via the AR head-mounted display device.

69.content: The phone whined and clicked with the construct’s efforts. Case carried it back into the room and put the receiver face up on the temperfoam. He went into the bathroom and brushed his teeth. As he was stepping back out, the monitor on the room’s Braun audiovisual complex lit up.
69.title: Method and apparatus for detecting an intruder in a residence
69.abstract: A method of detecting an intruder in a residence includes receiving, by a computing device, audio data from a plurality of microphones associated with the residence. The method further includes transmitting, by the computing device, a notification to a user's mobile device when it is determined that the one or more of the plurality of microphones have detected the at least one abnormal sound.

Part of my DNA, sort of…” He tossed the thing into the shadows and Case heard it pop and tinkle. “You’re always building models. Stone circles. Cathedrals. Pipe-organs. Adding machines.
71.title: Method and apparatus for accessing a memory of a computing device
