In response to determining that the amount of data to be written into the volatile memory of the computing device exceeds the predetermined threshold value, the method further comprises writing, by the processor, at least a portion of the determined amount of data into the non-volatile memory of the computing device.

72.title: Method and apparatus for detecting intruders
72.abstract: A method of detecting an intruder includes obtaining, by at least one processor, sensor data from sensors that are configured to sense the presence of an intruder. In response to determining that the sensor data satisfies the predetermined detection criteria, the method further includes transmitting, by the at least one processor, a notification message comprising information related to the sensor data satisfying the predetermined detection criteria. Additionally, in response to determining that the sensor data does not satisfy the predetermined detection criteria, the method further includes storing, by the at least one processor, the sensor data until the sensor data satisfies the predetermined detection criteria.

73.title: Apparatus and method for detecting unauthorized access to a computing device
73.abstract: A system, apparatus, and method are disclosed herein for detecting unauthorized access to a computing device. In one embodiment, an apparatus comprises at least one processor configured to execute computer-executable instructions stored in non-transitory memory coupled with the at least one processor that instructs the at least one processor to perform operations comprising obtaining sensor data from sensors associated with a computing device; determining whether the sensor data is within a predetermined range of values corresponding to authorized use of the computing device; and responsive to determining that the sensor data is not within the predetermined range of values, generating an alert indicative of unauthorized access to the computing device. Various other methods, systems, and apparatuses are also disclosed herein.

74.content: As he doubled over, clawing for the beeper on his belt she slammed his head sideways, against the wall of the elevator. Chewing a little more rapidly now, she touched CLOSE DOOR and STOP on the illuminated panel. She took a black box from her coat pocket and inserted a lead in the keyhole of the lock that secured the panel’s circuitry. The Panther Moderns allowed four minutes for their first move to take effect, then injected a second carefully prepared dose of misinformation. This time, they shot it directly into the Sense/Net building’s internal video system. At 12:04:03, every screen in the building strobed for eighteen seconds in a frequency that produced seizures in a susceptible segment of Sense/Net employees. Then something only vaguely like a human face filled the screens, its features stretched across asymmetrical expanses of bone like some obscene Mercator projection. Blue lips parted wetly as the twisted, elongated jaw moved. Something, perhaps a hand, a thing like a reddish clump of gnarled roots, fumbled toward the camera, blurred, and vanished. Subliminally rapid images of contamination: graphics of the building’s water supply system, gloved hands manipulating laboratory glassware, something tumbling down into darkness, a pale splash… The audio track, its pitch adjusted to run at just less than twice the standard playback speed, was part of a month-old newscast detailing potential military uses of a substance known as HsG, a biochemical governing the human skeletal growth factor.
74.title: Method and apparatus for defeating facial recognition systems
74.abstract: A method of preventing the use of biometric data to identify an individual is disclosed. The method includes capturing one or more images of at least a portion of a user's face, wherein the one or more images are captured in accordance with a predetermined set of conditions. The method further includes determining whether the one or more images satisfy the predetermined set of conditions. In response to determining that the one or more images satisfy the predetermined set of conditions, the method includes processing the one or more images to generate image data representative of features of the user's face included in the one or more images. The method additionally includes storing the image data along with information identifying the predetermined set of conditions under which the one or more images were captured.

75.content: Summer in the Sprawl, the mall crowds swaying like wind-blown grass, a field of flesh shot through with sudden eddies of need and gratification. He sat beside Molly in filtered sunlight on the rim of a dry concrete fountain, letting the endless stream of faces recapitulate the stages of his life. First a child with hooded eyes, a street boy, hands relaxed and ready at his sides; then a teenager, face smooth and cryptic beneath red glasses. Case remembered fighting on a rooftop at seventeen, silent combat in the rose glow of the dawn geodesics.
75.title: Screaming bikini

The bottom portion of the screaming bikini may include an elastic waistband, at least two side panels extending downwardly from the elastic waistband, and one or more leg openings formed between the elastic waistband and the side panels.

The Kuang swerved sickeningly, then reversed, whipping itself backward, shattering the illusion of a physical vehicle. The shadow thing was growing, spreading, blotting out the city of data.
76.title: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer-readable storage medium, for detecting anomalies in time series data. In some implementations, a computer system includes a processor and a non-transitory computer-

Various other methods, systems, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

77.title: Computer-implemented method, computer program product, and computer system for calculating last year's tax return

The computer-implemented method may include receiving an input from a user to initiate preparation of a previous year's tax return; determining whether the received input satisfies a predetermined criterion; in response to determining that the received input satisfies the predetermined criterion, retrieving one or more data items associated with the previous year's tax return stored in a database; analyzing the one or more data items to identify at least one inconsistency between the one or more data items; presenting information identifying the at least one inconsistency to the user via a graphical user interface (GUI); and enabling the user to resolve the at least one inconsistency by interacting with the GUI. Other embodiments are also disclosed herein.

78.content: The door was like the awkward cabinets, the huge crystal tree. 78.title: Apparatus and method for securing a door to a refrigerator or freezer

79.content: He saw the thing the shell of gray paper had concealed. Horror. The spiral birth factory, stepped terraces of the hatching cells, blind jaws of the unborn moving ceaselessly, the staged progress from egg to larva, near-wasp, wasp. In his mind’s eye, a kind of time-lapse photography took place, revealing the thing as the biological equivalent of a machine gun, hideous in its perfection. Alien. He pulled the trigger, forgetting to press the ignition, and fuel hissed over the bulging, writhing life at his feet.
79.title: Method and apparatus for pest control

80.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for detecting and responding to anomalies. In some implementations, an anomaly detection system may receive data from one or more sensors that are configured to collect sensor data associated with at least one physical object. Responsive to determining that there is evidence of an anomaly affecting the at least one physical object, the anomaly detection system may generate an alert indicating the presence of the anomaly in the at least one physical object. Numerous other aspects are described in detail in the claims, drawings, and textual description heretofore provided, and in response to such detailed descriptions, which can be rendered in software, hardware, or otherwise by one of ordinary skill in the art.

83.title: Method and apparatus for detecting intruders in an enclosed space
83.abstract: A method of detecting intruders in an enclosed space is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of: (a) providing at least one acoustic signal; (b) receiving, from each of a plurality of microphones positioned within the enclosed space, signals indicative of sound waves emitted by the acoustic signal(s); (c) analysing the received signals to determine whether any of the received signals are above a pre-determined threshold level; and (d) if it is determined that none of the received signals are above the pre-determined threshold level, determining that no intruder is present in the enclosed space. Corresponding apparatus, systems, computers program products, computer readable media, and

87.content: Then Case was beside him. The hatch was centered in a round, vaulted chamber floored with blue nonslip plastic tiles. Maelcum nudged him, pointed, and he saw a monitor set into a curved wall. On the screen, a tall young man with the Tessier-Ashpool features was brushing something from the sleeves of his dark suitcoat. He stood beside an identical hatch, in an identical chamber. “Very sorry, sir,” said a voice from a grid centered above the hatch. Case glanced up. “Expected you later, at the axial dock. One moment, please.” On the monitor, the young man tossed his head impatiently. Maelcum spun as a door slid open to their left, the shotgun ready. A small Eurasian in orange coveralls stepped through and goggled at them.

87.abstract: Method includes receiving an input from a user to generate a Tessier-Ashpool family tree; identifying at least one character associated with the Tessier-Ashpool family tree in response to receipt of the input; retrieving information related to the at least one character identified by the computing device; determining that the retrieved information does not satisfy a predetermined criterion; modifying the retrieved information to satisfy the predetermined criterion when it is determined that the retrieved information does not satisfy the predetermined criterion; and displaying the modified retrieved information as part of the Tessier-Ashpool family tree generated by the computing device.

88.content: The Finn was a fence, a trafficker in stolen goods, primarily in software. In the course of his business, he sometimes came into contact with other fences, some of whom dealt in the more traditional articles of the trade. In precious metals, stamps, rare coins, gems, jewelry, furs, and paintings and other works of art. The story he told Case and Molly began with another man’s story, a man he called Smith. Smith was also a fence, but in balmier seasons he surfaced as an art dealer. He was the first person the Finn had known who’d “gone silicon”— the phrase had an old-fashioned ring for Case—and the microsofts he purchased were art history programs and tables of gallery sales. With half a dozen chips in his new socket, Smith’s knowledge of the art business was formidable, at least by the standards of his colleagues. But Smith had come to the Finn with a request for help, a fraternal request, one businessman to another. He wanted a go-to on the Tessier-Ashpool clan, he said, and it had to be executed in a way that would guarantee the impossibility of the subject ever tracing the inquiry to its source. It might be possible, the Finn had opined, but an explanation was definitely required. “It smelled,” the Finn said to Case, “smelled of money.
88.title: Method and apparatus for detecting and preventing fraudulent transactions
88.abstract: A method of authenticating an electronic transaction is disclosed. The method includes receiving, from a user device associated with a user, a request to initiate an electronic transaction; determining whether the requested electronic transaction satisfies one or more predetermined conditions; in response to determining that the requested electronic transaction does not satisfy the one or more predetermined conditions, transmitting, to the user device, a notification indicating that the requested electronic transaction will not be authorized; receiving, from the user device, at least one piece of biometric information associated with the user; comparing the at least one piece of biometric information received from the user device with previously stored biometric information associated with the user; and approving the requested electronic transaction when there is a match between the two sets of biometric information. Corresponding apparatus, systems, devices and computer programs products are also disclosed.

89.content: ” “Case”—and for an instant something seemed to move, behind the blue stare—“you’ve seen Wintermute, haven’t you? In the matrix.” Case nodded. A camera on the face of his Hosaka in Marcus Garvey would relay the gesture to the Haniwa monitor. He imagined Maelcum listening to his tranced half conversations, unable to hear the voices of the construct or Armitage. “Case”—and the eyes grew larger, Armitage leaning toward his computer—“what is he, when you see him?” “A high-rez simstim construct.”
89.title: Method and apparatus for simulated telepresence using a high-resolution simstim construct
89.abstract: A method of providing an immersive experience to a user is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of (a) obtaining data from at least one sensory input device; (b) processing the data in accordance with predetermined parameters so as to generate visual, auditory and/or tactile stimuli; (c) presenting the visual, auditory and/or tactile stimuli such that they are perceivable by the user; and (d) repeating steps (a), (b) and (c) over a period of time. An apparatus for providing an immersive experience to a user is also disclosed.

90.content: The tunnel ended with an ancient Army blanket tacked across a doorway. White light flooded out as Molly ducked past it. Four square walls of blank white plastic, ceiling to match, floored with white hospital tile molded in a non slip pattern of small raised disks. In the center stood a square, white-painted wooden table and four white folding chairs. The man who stood blinking now in the doorway behind them, the blanket draping one shoulder like a cape, seemed to have been designed in a wind tunnel. His ears were very small, plastered flat against his narrow skull, and his large front teeth, revealed in something that wasn’t quite a smile, were canted sharply backward. He wore an ancient tweed jacket and held a handgun of some kind in his left hand. He peered at them, blinked, and dropped the gun into a jacket pocket. He gestured to Case, pointed at a slab of white plastic that leaned near the doorway. Case crossed to it and saw that it was a solid sandwich of circuitry, nearly a centimeter thick. He helped the man lift it and position it in the doorway. Quick, nicotine-stained fingers secured it with a white velcro border. A hidden exhaust fan began to purr. “Time,” the man said, straightening up, “and counting.
90.title: Apparatus and method for detecting unauthorized access to a secure area
90.abstract: A system, apparatus, and method are disclosed herein for detecting unauthorized access to a secure area. In one embodiment, the system comprises a plurality of sensors configured to generate sensor data indicative of an individual's presence in the secure area; at least one processor configured to receive the sensor data from the plurality of sensors via a communications link between the plurality of sensors and the at least one processor; and memory coupled to the at least one processor storing instructions that when executed by the at least one processor cause the at least one processor to analyze the sensor data received from the plurality of sensors to determine whether the individual is authorized or unauthorized to be present in the secure area.

91.content: Semiotics course.” “The architects of Freeside went to great pains to conceal the fact that the interior of the spindle is arranged with the banal precision of furniture in a hotel room. In Straylight, the hull’s inner surface is overgrown with a desperate proliferation of structures, forms flowing, interlocking, rising toward a solid core of microcircuitry, our clan’s corporate heart, a cylinder of silicon wormholed with narrow maintenance tunnels, some no wider than a man’s hand. The bright crabs burrow there, the drones, alert for micromechanical decay or sabotage.” “That was her you saw in the restaurant,” the Finn said. “By the standards of the archipelago,” the head continued, “ours is an old family, the convolutions of our home reflecting that age. But reflecting something else as well. The semiotics of the Villa bespeak a turning in, a denial of the bright void beyond the hull. “Tessier and Ashpool climbed the well of gravity to discover that they loathed space. They built Freeside to tap the wealth of the new islands, grew rich and eccentric, and began the construction of an extended body in Straylight. We have sealed ourselves away behind our money, growing inward, generating a seamless universe of self.
91.title: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer-readable storage medium, for managing an archipelago. In some implementations, the archipelago comprises a plurality of islands, each island
91.abstract: implemented by one or more computing devices associated with at least one island of the plurality of islands; determining whether to add another island to the archipelago in response to detecting that there are fewer than a first predetermined number of islands in the archipelago; adding the other island to the archipelago in response to determining that there are fewer than the first predetermined number of islands in the archipelago; and causing instructions to be output. Various other methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer-readable storage medium, are also disclosed.

92.content: They were standing in a broad street that seemed to be the floor of a deep slot or canyon, its either end concealed by subtle angles in the shops and buildings that formed its walls. The light, here, was filtered through fresh green masses of vegetation tumbling from overhanging tiers and balconies that rose above them. The sun… There was a brilliant slash of white somewhere above them too bright, and the recorded blue of a Cannes sky. He knew that sunlight was pumped in with a Lado-Acheson system whose two-millimeter armature ran the length of the spindle, that they generated a rotating library of sky effects around it, that if the sky were turned off, he’d stare up past the armature of light to the curves of lakes, rooftops of casinos, other streets—
92.title: Method and apparatus for simulating a virtual environment
92.abstract: A method of simulating a virtual environment is disclosed. The method includes receiving, by a computing device, an indication of at least one object to be included in the virtual environment; determining, by the computing device, that the at least one object does not already exist in the virtual environment; adding, by the computing device, the at least one object to the virtual environment such that the at least one object exists in the virtual environment; transmitting, by the computing device, information about the at least one object from the computing device to another computing device connected to the computing device via a communication network; and updating, by the computing device, a representation of the at least one object in the virtual environment responsive to receipt of updated information about the at least one object from the other computing device through the communication network. Various other methods, systems, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

93.title: Apparatus and method for preventing the spread of COVID-19 and other infectious diseases
93.abstract: A system, apparatus, and method are disclosed for controlling airborne pathogens such as SARS-CoV-2 (the virus that causes COVID-19) in an enclosed space.

94.content: A narrow wedge of light from a half-open service hatch framed a heap of discarded fiber optics and the chassis of a junked console. He’d fallen face forward on a slab of soggy chip board, he rolled over, into the shadow of the console. The cubicle’s window was a square of faint light. The alarm still oscillated, louder here, the rear wall dulling the roar of the games. A head appeared, framed in the window, back lit by the fluorescents in the corridor, then vanished. It returned, but he still couldn’t read the features. Glint of silver across the eyes. “Shit,” someone said, a woman, in the accent of the northern Sprawl.
94.title: Method and apparatus for cleaning an optical fiber connector
94.abstract: A method of cleaning an optical fiber connector includes inserting the optical fiber connector into a housing, wherein the optical fiber connector comprises at least one optical fiber. The method further includes rotating the optical fiber connector within the housing while applying vibration to the optical fiber connector in order to dislodge debris that is adhered to the at least one optical fiber from the optical fiber connector; and removing the optical fiber connector from the housing.

95.title: Systems and methods for detecting anomalies in network traffic
95.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure provide systems and methods for detecting anomalies in network traffic. In one implementation, a method includes receiving, by a computing device, an indication of packet data associated with a communication session between a first user equipment (UE) and a second UE. The method further includes determining, by the computing device, whether to classify the packet data as benign or malicious based at least in part on characteristics of the packet data. The method additionally includes transmitting, by the computing device, information indicating that the packet data should be classified as either benign or malicious. Further, the method includes performing, by the computing device, one or more actions based at least in part on whether the packet data was classified as benign or malicious.

However much he is under control,” he added. “He,” the construct said. “He. Watch that. It. I keep telling you.” “It’s a code. A word, he said. Somebody has to speak it into a fancy terminal in a certain room, while we take care of whatever’s waiting for us behind that ice.”
96.title: Systems and methods for controlling an autonomous vehicle
96.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for controlling an autonomous vehicle. In one implementation, a method includes receiving sensor data from sensors associated with an autonomous vehicle (AV), wherein the AV is traveling along a roadway. The method also includes determining that the AV has entered into a lane change maneuver to transition between first and second lanes of the roadway. The method further includes transmitting instructions to at least one steering actuator of the AV to cause the AV to execute the lane change maneuver in response to determining that the AV has entered into the lane change maneuver.

97.content: He warmed himself with it, unable to give it a name or an object. He rode the elevator down to his level, fumbling in his pocket for the Freeside credit chip that served as his key. Sleep was becoming real, was something he might do. To lie down on the sand-colored temperfoam and find the blankness again. They were waiting there, the three of them, their perfect white sportsclothes and stenciled tans setting off the handwoven organic chic of the furniture. The girl sat on a wicker sofa, an automatic pistol beside her on the leaf-patterned print of the cushion. “Turing,” she said. “You are under arrest.” Part IV: The Straylight Run Chapter Thirteen “Your name is Henry Dorsett Case.” She recited the year and place of his birth, his BAMA Single Identification Number, and a string of names he gradually recognized as aliases from his past.
97.title: Method and apparatus for authenticating a user in a virtual reality environment
97.abstract: A method of authenticating a user in a virtual reality (VR) environment is provided. The method includes receiving, by an electronic device from a VR headset coupled to the electronic device, one or more biometric data associated with a user wearing the VR headset; transmitting, by the electronic device, the one or more biometric data to a remote server; determining, by the electronic device, that the one or more biometric data received from the VR headset matches previously-stored biometric data corresponding to the user; and unlocking, by the electronic device, at least one function of the electronic device upon determining that the one or more biometric data received from the VR headset matches the previously-stored biometric data corresponding to the user. A related apparatus, system, and computer readable medium are also disclosed.

98.content: Case edged sideways on the circular ladder and climbed the last few rungs. The gangway ended in a smooth, slightly convex hatch, two meters in diameter. The hydraulic members of the tube vanished into flexible housings set into the frame of the hatch. “So what do we—” Case’s mouth shut as the hatch swung up, a slight differential in pressure puffing fine grit into his eyes. Maelcum scrambled up, over the edge, and Case heard the tiny click of the Remington’s safety being released.
98.title: Method and apparatus for deploying an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) from a submersible vehicle (SV)
98.abstract: A method of operating an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) includes receiving, by the UAV, a command to launch. In response to receiving the command to launch, the UAV is deployed from a submersible vehicle (SV).

99.content: Sammi’s was an inflated dome behind a port side warehouse, taut gray fabric reinforced with a net of thin steel cables. The corridor, with a door at either end, was a crude airlock preserving the pressure differential that supported the dome. Fluorescent rings were screwed to the plywood ceiling at intervals, but most of them had been broken. The air was damp and close with the smell of sweat and concrete. None of that prepared him for the arena, the crowd, the tense hush, the towering puppets of light beneath the dome. Concrete sloped away in tiers to a kind of central stage, a raised circle ringed with a glittering thicket of projection gear. No light but the holograms that shifted and flickered above the ring, reproducing the movements of the two men below. Strata of cigarette smoke rose from the tiers, drifting until it struck currents set up by the blowers that supported the dome.
99.title: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer-readable storage medium, for holographic boxing matches. In example embodiments, a method includes generating a three-dimensional (3D) model of
99.abstract: a virtual fighter; receiving an input from a user to initiate a match between the virtual fighter and one or more additional virtual fighters; determining that at least one of the one or more additional virtual fighters is controlled by another user; transmitting information identifying the other user to the other user's computing device; communicating with the other user's computing device to establish a real-time communication session between the virtual fighter and the one or more additional virtual fighters controlled by the other user; controlling movement of the virtual fighter during the real-time communication session in accordance with movements of the one or more additional virtual fighters controlled by the other user; simulating interactions between the virtual fighter and the one or more additional virtual fighters controlled by the other user within the real-time communication session; and outputting results of the simulated interactions as video data representative of a live event.

100.title: Systems and methods for managing addictive behaviors
100.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure relate to systems and methods for managing addictive behaviors. In one implementation, a computer-implemented method may include receiving an indication that a user is engaging in at least one behavior associated with an addiction; determining whether the received indication satisfies a predetermined criterion; responsive to determining that the received indication satisfies the predetermined criterion, transmitting a notification indicating that the user is engaging in the at least one behavior associated with the addiction; and providing access to information related to the addiction via a graphical user interface (GUI).

101.content: He tightened the nylon harness that held him in the chair and replaced the trodes. Routine now: trodes, jack, and flip. The Sense/Net research library was a dead storage area; the materials stored here had to be physically removed before they could be interfaced.
101.title: Systems and methods for neurophysiological data acquisition and analysis
101.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for acquiring, analyzing, and displaying neurophysiological data. In some implementations, an implantable medical device (IMD) may be configured to detect one or more physiological parameters associated with a patient's nervous system using at least one sensing electrode coupled to the IMD. The IMD may also be configured to analyze the one or more physiological parameters detected by the at least one sensing electrode in order to determine whether the patient is experiencing a seizure event. If the IMD determines that the patient is experiencing a seizure event, the IMD may cause stimulation therapy to be applied to the patient's nervous system through application of electrical pulses via the at least one sensing electrode.

102.content: They all seemed to have carbon sockets planted behind the left ear, but she didn’t focus on them. The counters that fronted the booths displayed hundreds of slivers of microsoft, angular fragments of colored silicon mounted under oblong transparent bubbles on squares of white cardboard. Molly went to the seventh booth along the south wall. Behind the counter a boy with a shaven head stared vacantly into space, a dozen spikes of microsoft protruding from the socket behind his ear. “Larry, you in, man?” She positioned herself in front of him. The boy’s eyes focused. He sat up in his chair and pried a bright magenta splinter from his socket with a dirty thumbnail. “Hey, Larry.”
102.title: Method and apparatus for securely transferring data between a mobile device and a computing device
102.abstract: A method of securely transferring data between a mobile device and a computing device is disclosed. The method includes receiving, at the mobile device from the computing device, a first request to initiate an authentication process; transmitting, by the mobile device in response to receipt of the first request, a first challenge to the computing device; receiving, by the mobile device in response to transmission of the first challenge, a second challenge from the computing device; verifying, by the mobile device in response to receipt of the second challenge, that the computing device is authorized to communicate with the mobile device; authenticating, by the mobile device in response to verification that the computing device is authorized to communicate with the mobile device; and transmitting, by the mobile device in response to authentication of the computing device, encrypted data to the computing device. Various other methods, systems, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

103.content: They stood in a clearing, dense tangles of junk rising on either side to walls lined with shelves of crumbling paperbacks. The junk looked like something that had grown there, a fungus of twisted metal and plastic. He could pick out individual objects, but then they seemed to blur back into the mass: the guts of a television so old it was studded with the glass stumps of vacuum tubes, a crumpled dish antenna, a brown fiber canister stuffed with corroded lengths of alloy tubing. An enormous pile of old magazines had cascaded into the open area, flesh of lost summers staring blindly up as he followed her back through a narrow canyon of impacted scrap.
103.title: Method and apparatus for recycling electronic devices
103.abstract: A method of recycling an electronic device includes receiving the electronic device from a user, wherein the electronic device comprises one or more processors. The method also includes determining that the electronic device is eligible for recycling by analyzing data stored in volatile memory associated with at least one of the one or more processors. The method further includes disassembling the electronic device into component parts after determining that the electronic device is eligible for recycling.

104.content: Each pixel a million megabytes. At a hundred million megabytes per second, you begin to make out certain blocks in midtown Manhattan, outlines of hundred-year-old industrial parks ringing the old core of Atlanta… Case woke from a dream of airports, of Molly’s dark leathers moving ahead of him through the concourses of Narita, Schipol, Orly… He watched himself buy a flat plastic flask of Danish vodka at some kiosk, an hour before dawn. Somewhere down in the Sprawl’s ferro-concrete roots, a train drove a column of stale air through a tunnel. The train itself was silent, gliding over its induction cushion, but displaced air made the tunnel sing, bass down into subsonics.
104.title: Augmented reality system and method
104.abstract: An augmented reality (AR) system includes an AR device configured to capture images of a real-world environment in which the AR device is disposed. The AR device further includes one or more processors coupled to non-transitory computer readable media storing instructions that, when executed by the one or more processors, cause the one or more processors to perform operations comprising receiving image data captured by the AR device; processing the image data to identify at least one object depicted in the image data; determining whether the at least one object identified in the image data satisfies predetermined criteria; and responsive to determining that the at least one object satisfies the predetermined criteria, presenting information associated with the at least one object via the AR device. Various other aspects are contemplated.

105.content: You know that?” 3Jane raised her eyebrows. “Peter’s suggested something like that, but tell me more.” “I met Neuromancer. He talked about your mother. I think he’s something like a giant ROM construct, for recording personality, only it’s full RAM. The constructs think they’re there, like it’s real, but it just goes on forever.” 3Jane stepped from behind the bathchair.
105.title: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for detecting anomalies in network traffic
105.abstract: A method of detecting anomalies in network traffic includes receiving data packets from a plurality of nodes. The received data packets are analyzed to determine whether the received data packets conform to one or more predetermined protocols. In response to determining that at least some of the received data packets do not conform to the one or more predetermined protocols, an anomaly is detected. Responsive to detecting the anomaly, mitigation action(s) are taken with respect to the at least some of the received data packets failing to conform to the one or more predetermined protocols.

His teeth sang in their individual sockets like tuning forks, each one pitch-perfect and clear as ethanol. His bones, beneath the hazy envelope of flesh, were chromed and polished, the joints lubricated with a film of silicone. Sand-storms raged across the scoured floor of his skull, generating waves of high thin static that broke behind his eyes, spheres of purest crystal, expanding…
106.title: Method and apparatus for treating or preventing a neurodegenerative disorder by administering a therapeutically effective amount of a cannabinoid receptor type 1 (CB1) agonist
106.abstract: Provided herein is a method of treating or preventing a neurodegenerative disorder comprising administering to a subject in need thereof a therapeutically effective amount of a cannabinoid receptor type 1 (CB1) agonist. Also provided herein is a method of treating or preventing a neurodegenerative disorder comprising administering to a subject in need thereof a therapeutically effective amount of a pharmaceutical composition comprising a cannabinoid receptor type 1 (CB1) agonist and a pharmaceutically acceptable carrier. Further provided herein is a method of treating or preventing a neurodegenerative disorder comprising administering to a subject in need thereof a therapeutically effective amount of a pharmaceutical composition comprising a cannabinoid receptor type

107.content: This is memory, right? I tap you, sort it out, and feed it back in.” “I don’t have this good a memory,” Case said, looking around.
107.title: Apparatus and method for detecting unauthorized access to a computing device
107.abstract: Implementations of apparatuses and methods for detecting unauthorized access to a computing device are disclosed herein. In one implementation, an apparatus includes at least one processor configured to execute machine-readable instructions that cause the apparatus to perform operations comprising obtaining sensor data from sensors coupled to the computing device; analyzing the sensor data to identify anomalies in the sensor data indicative of unauthorized access to the computing device; determining whether any of the identified anomalies satisfy predetermined criteria associated with each of the identified anomalies; and responsive to determining that none of the identified anomalies satisfy the predetermined criteria associated with each of the identified anomalies, indicating that the computing device has not been accessed by an unauthorized user.

108.content: A BAMA Rapid Deployment helicopter was lifting off from its pad on Riker’s. Case triggered his second program. A carefully engineered virus attacked the code fabric screening primary custodial commands for the sub-basement that housed the Sense/Net research materials. “Boston,” Molly’s voice came across the link, “I’m downstairs.” Case switched and saw the blank wall of the elevator. She was unzipping the white pants. A bulky packet, exactly the shade of her pale ankle, was secured there with micro pore. She knelt and peeled the tape away. Streaks of burgundy flickered across the mimetic polycarbon as she unfolded the Modem suit. She removed the pink raincoat, threw it down beside the white pants, and began to pull the suit on over the white mesh top.
108.title: Rapid deployment helicopter
108.abstract: A rapid deployment helicopter is provided. The rapid deployment helicopter includes a fuselage, a main rotor system and a tail rotor system. The main rotor system comprises a plurality of blades mounted to the fuselage for rotation about a first longitudinal axis. The tail rotor system comprises a plurality of blades mounted to the fuselage for rotation about a second longitudinal axis substantially perpendicular to the first longitudinal axis.

109.content: “You help me string this up.” He looked around the wide, featureless space and noticed steel rings welded on every surface, seemingly at random. When they’d strung the cables, according to some complex scheme of Molly’s, they hung them with battered sheets of yellow plastic. As they worked, Case gradually became aware of the music that pulsed constantly through the cluster. It was called dub, a sensuous mosaic cooked from vast libraries of digitalized pop; it was worship, Molly said, and a sense of community. Case heaved at one of the yellow sheets; the thing was light but still awkward.
109.title: Method and apparatus for installing a suspended ceiling
109.abstract: A method of installing a suspended ceiling in a building, the suspended ceiling comprising a plurality of t-shaped structural members. The method includes positioning at least some of the t-shaped structural members so that they are spaced apart from adjacent ones of the t-shaped structural members by a predetermined distance to form an air gap therebetween; securing one or more of the t-shaped structural members to corresponding ones of the building's roof trusses with fasteners such that each secured t-shaped structural member is separated from its adjacent unsecured t-shaped structural member by the same predetermined distance as when the t-shaped structural members were initially positioned; and attaching acoustic panels to the t-shaped structural members prior to completing installation of the remainder of the suspended ceiling.

110.content: He knew that the trodes he used and the little plastic tiara dangling from a Simstim deck were basically the same, and that the cyberspace matrix was actually a drastic simplification of the human sensorium, at least in terms of presentation, but Simstim itself struck him as a gratuitous multiplication of flesh input. The commercial stuff was edited, of course, so that if Tally Isham got a headache in the course of a segment, you didn’t feel it. The screen bleeped a two-second warning. The new switch was patched into his Sendai with a thin ribbon of fiber optics. And one and two and— Cyberspace slid into existence from the cardinal points.
110.title: Method and apparatus for treating neuropsychiatric disorders using transcranial direct current stimulation (tDCS) and transcranial alternating current stimulation (tACS)
110.abstract: Provided is a method of treating a neuropsychiatric disorder in a patient, the method comprising administering at least one non-invasive electrical stimulation therapy to the patient.

111.content: “I’m all doped,” he protested, but reached for the trodes. His deck and the Hosaka had been mounted behind Maelcum’s module along with a very high-resolution Cray monitor. He adjusted the trodes. Marcus Garvey had been thrown together around an enormous old Russian air scrubber, a rectangular thing daubed with Rastafarian symbols, Lions of Zion and Black Star Liners, the reds and greens and yellows over-laying wordy decals in Cyrillic script. Someone had sprayed Maelcum’s pilot gear a hot tropical pink, scraping most of the overspray off the screens and readouts with a razor blade. The gaskets around the airlock in the bow were festooned with semirigid globs and streamers of translucent caulk, like clumsy strands of imitation seaweed. He glanced past Maelcum’s shoulder to the central screen and saw a docking display: the tug’s path was a line of red dots, Freeside a segmented green circle. He watched the line extend itself, generating a new dot. He jacked in.
111.title: Method and apparatus for interfacing with a virtual reality environment
111.abstract: A method of interacting with a virtual reality (VR) environment is disclosed. The method comprises detecting, by one or more sensors associated with a VR headset worn by a user, at least one gesture performed by the user; in response to detecting the at least one gesture, determining whether the at least one gesture corresponds to an input command that can be executed within the VR environment; responsive to determining that the at least one gesture does not correspond to an input command that can be executed within the VR environment, transmitting data indicative of the at least one gesture to a computing device external to the VR headset; and responsive to determining that the at least one gesture corresponds to an input command that can be executed within the VR environment, executing the input command within the VR environment.

112.content: Past unseeing faces, every eye raised to the victor’s image above the ring. Once a seamed European face danced in the glare of a match, lips pursed around the short stem of a metal pipe. Tang of hashish.
112.title: Apparatus and method for smoking cannabis
112.abstract: An apparatus for smoking cannabis is disclosed. The apparatus comprises an elongated tube having a proximal end and a distal end opposite the proximal end, wherein at least one of the proximal end or the distal end includes a mouthpiece configured to facilitate inhalation of vaporized cannabis through the mouthpiece into the lungs of a user.

113.content: She stalked the room, Ashpool’s automatic in her hand. A vast quilt or comforter was heaped beside the bed, in a broad puddle of congealed blood, thick and shiny on the patterned rugs. Twitching a corner of the quilt back, she found the body of a girl, white shoulder blades slick with blood.
113.title: Method and apparatus for detecting an intruder in a dwelling
113.abstract: A method of detecting an intruder in a dwelling, the method comprising obtaining (i) motion data indicative of movement of at least one person within the dwelling over a predetermined period of time; (ii) sound data indicative of sounds occurring within the dwelling over the predetermined period of time; and (iii) image data indicative of images captured within the dwelling over the predetermined period of time. The method further comprises analysing the motion data, the sound data and the image data to determine whether any unusual activity has occurred within the dwelling during the predetermined period of time.

114.content: Case followed him into a larger space, a kind of lounge, shredding and crumpling the lengths of printout that snared him in his passage. There were more of the articulated chairs, here, something that resembled a bar, and the Hosaka. The printer, still spewing its flimsy tongue of paper, was an inbuilt bulkhead unit, a neat slot in a panel of handrubbed veneer. He pulled himself over the circle of chairs and reached it, punching a white stud to the left of the slot.
114.title: Apparatus, system and method for detecting and/or preventing unauthorized access to an electronic device
114.abstract: An apparatus comprising one or more processors configured to execute instructions stored in non-transitory memory. The execution of the instructions by the one or more processors causes the one or more processors to perform operations comprising receiving at least one biometric input from a user; determining whether the at least one biometric input corresponds to a previously registered biometric input associated with a trusted user; responsive to determining that the at least one biometric input does not correspond to the previously registered biometric input associated with the trusted user, transmitting data indicative of the received at least one biometric input to a remote server via a cellular network; and upon receipt of a confirmation message from the remote server indicating that the user is authorized to utilize the electronic device, enabling use of the electronic device by the user. Various other aspects are contemplated.

115.content: Aerol had been waiting at one of the sporting docks at the end of the spindle, near the weightless axis. To reach it Case had taken an elevator down to the hull and ridden a miniature induction train. As the diameter of the spindle narrowed, gravity decreased; somewhere above him, he’d decided, would be the mountains Molly climbed, the bicycle loop, launching gear for the hang gliders and miniature microlights. Aerol had ferried him out to Marcus Garvey in a skeletal scooter frame with a chemical engine. “Two hour ago,” Maelcum said, “I take delivery of Babylon goods for you; nice Japan-boy inna yacht, mos’ pretty yacht.” Free of the suit, Case pulled himself gingerly over the Hosaka and fumbled into the straps of the web. “Well,” he said, “let’s see it.” Maelcum produced a white lump of foam slightly smaller than Case’s head, fished a pearl-handled switchblade on a green nylon lanyard out of the hip pocket of his tattered shorts, and carefully slit the plastic. He extracted a rectangular object and passed it to Case. “Thas part some gun, mon?” “No,” Case said, turning it over, “but it’s a weapon. It’s virus.” “Not on this boy tug, mon,” Maelcum said firmly, reaching for the steel cassette. “A program. Virus program. Can’t get into you, can’t even get into your software. I’ve got to interface it through the deck, before it can work on anything.” “Well, Japan-mon, he says Hosaka here’ll tell you every what an’ wherefore, you wanna know.” “Okay.
115.title: Method and apparatus for controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV)
115.abstract: A method of controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of: determining, by at least one sensor associated with the UAV, a current position of the UAV relative to a target location; identifying whether the current position of the UAV satisfies a predetermined condition; in response to identification that the current position of the UAV does not satisfy the predetermined condition, adjusting a flight path of the UAV so as to approach the target location; and in response to identification that the current position of the UAV satisfies the predetermined condition, causing the UAV to land at the target location.

116.content: He thumbed open the vacuum valves on the workbelt’s gray pads and freed himself, retrieving the thing he’d removed. He kicked back, gliding over his instruments—a green docking diagram pulsed on his central screen—and snagged the frame of Case’s g-web. He pulled himself down and picked at the tape of his package with a thick, chipped thumbnail. “Some man in China say th’ truth comes out this,” he said, unwrapping an ancient, oilslick Remington automatic shotgun, its barrel chopped off a few millimeters in front of the battered forestock. The shoulderstock had been removed entirely, replaced with a wooden pistolgrip wound with dull black tape.
116.title: Vacuum cleaner powered by humanity's most precious resource: trash
116.abstract: A vacuum cleaner is disclosed. The vacuum cleaner comprises a housing, an air intake port in the housing, and a suction motor within the housing. The vacuum cleaner further comprises at least one filter positioned between the air intake port and the suction motor for filtering debris from ambient air drawn into the vacuum cleaner through the air intake port prior to entering the suction motor. A method of using the vacuum cleaner is also disclosed.

Her vision seemed to have narrowed to a tunnel. With the third step, Case screamed and found himself back in the matrix. “Brood?
117.title: Method and apparatus for treating a patient's body cavity
117.abstract: A method of treating a patient's body cavity includes inserting an endoscope into the body cavity, wherein the endoscope comprises at least one illumination source. The method further includes activating the at least one illumination source such that light is emitted from the at least one illumination source in response to insertion of the endoscope into the body cavity.

118.content: “Wintermute. How he played a waiting game for years. Didn’t have any real power, then, but he could use the Villa’s security and custodial systems to keep track of where everything was, how things moved, where they went. He saw somebody lose this key twenty years ago, and he managed to get somebody else to leave it here. Then he killed him, the boy who’d brought it here.
118.title: Method and apparatus for controlling an autonomous vehicle
118.abstract: A method of controlling an autonomous vehicle includes determining, by one or more sensors associated with the autonomous vehicle, that the autonomous vehicle is to be parked in a parking space. The method also includes receiving, by a processor associated with the autonomous vehicle, input from a user directing the autonomous vehicle to park in the parking space. The method further includes actuating, by the processor, at least one wheel of the autonomous vehicle to drive the autonomous vehicle into the parking space when the autonomous vehicle is determined to be within a predetermined distance from the parking space.

119.content: “You will come with us. We are at home with situations of legal ambiguity. The treaties under which our arm of the Registry operates grant us a great deal of flexibility. And we create flexibility, in situations where it is required.” The mask of amiability was down, suddenly, Roland’s eyes as hard as Pierre’s.
119.title: Apparatus and method for determining an identity of a user of a computing device
119.abstract: A system, apparatus, and/or method may be provided to determine an identity of a user of a computing device. For example, in some embodiments, one or more sensors associated with the computing device may generate sensor data indicative of at least one physiological characteristic of a user of the computing device. The sensor data may be transmitted from the computing device to a server that is remote from the computing device. The server may analyze the sensor data using machine learning techniques (e.g., artificial neural networks) to determine an identity of the user of the computing device.

120.content: The bare steel and scabrous epoxy ended abruptly, replaced by what Case at first took to be a rough tunnel blasted from solid rock. Molly examined its edge and he saw that in fact the steel was sheathed with panels of something that looked and felt like cold stone. She knelt and touched the dark sand spread across the floor of the imitation tunnel. It felt like sand, cool and dry, but when she drew her finger through it, it closed like a fluid, leaving the surface undisturbed. A dozen meters ahead, the tunnel curved.
120.title: Method and apparatus for interplanetary travel
120.abstract: A method of controlling an autonomous spacecraft is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of: (a) receiving, by at least one sensor associated with the spacecraft, data indicative of environmental conditions experienced by the spacecraft; (b) determining, from the received data, a current position of the spacecraft relative to Earth; (c) predicting, in response to step (b), a future position of the spacecraft relative to Earth; (d) calculating, in response to step (c), a propulsive manoeuvre required to change the predicted future position of the spacecraft away from Earth; (e) generating control signals corresponding to the calculated propulsive manoeuvre; and (f) transmitting the generated control signals to actuators operatively associated with the spacecraft so as to cause the spacecraft to perform the determined propulsive manoeuvre.

121.content: He nodded, gave Mollyathumbs-upsalute,andgesturedtoCasetohelphimwiththedoorpanel. WhileCasesmoothed the velcro border into place, the Finn took a flat little console from his pocket and punched out an elaborate sequence. “Honey,” he said to Molly, tucking the console away, “you have got it.
121.title: Apparatus and method for securing a door panel in a vehicle
121.abstract: A security apparatus is disclosed. The security apparatus includes a sensor configured to detect movement of the security apparatus, an actuator configured to move the security apparatus between at least a locked position and an unlocked position, and a controller communicatively coupled to the sensor and the actuator. The controller is configured to cause the actuator to move the security apparatus from the locked position to the unlocked position responsive to detection by the sensor that the security apparatus has been moved beyond a predetermined threshold during a predetermined time period.

122.content: Broken. A patch of brilliantly white micropore covered her damaged lens; the other flashed emptily as her head bobbed with the motion of the chair. “A familiar face,” 3Jane said, “I saw you the night of Peter’s show. And who is this?” “Maelcum,” Case said. “Hideo, remove the arrow and bandage Mr. Malcolm’s wound.” Case was staring at Molly, at the wan face. The ninja walked to where Maelcum sat, pausing to lay his bow and the shotgun well out of reach, and took something from his pocket. A pair of bolt cutters.
122.title: Method and apparatus for treating an ophthalmic disorder
122.abstract: A method of treating an ophthalmic disorder in a subject comprising administering to the subject one or more doses of at least one therapeutically effective amount of anti-VEGF antibodies, such as bevacizumab (Avastin), ranibizumab (Lucentis) or aflibercept (Eylea).

123.content: White boulders, a stand of green bamboo, black gravel raked into smooth waves. A gardener, a thing like a large metal crab, was tending the bamboo. “It’ll work, Case. You got no idea, the kind of stuff Armitage has. Like he’s gonna pay these nerve boys for fixing you with the program he’s giving them to tell them how to do it. He’ll put them three years ahead of the competition.
123.title: Method and apparatus for treating neurological disorders by electrical pulses
123.abstract: A method of treating a neurological disorder in a patient comprising delivering to the patient an electrical stimulation pulse having a frequency between about 0.1 Hz and about 100 Hz, wherein the electrical stimulation pulse is delivered at a duty cycle greater than or equal to about 5% and less than or equal to about 95%.

124.content: Case waited for a trans-BAMA local on the crowded platform. Molly had gone back to the loft hours ago, the Flatline’s construct in her green bag, and Case had been drinking steadily ever since. It was disturbing to think of the Flatline as a construct, a hardwired ROM cassette replicating a dead man’s skills, obsessions, kneejerk responses… The local came booming in along the black induction strip, fine grit sifting from cracks in the tunnel’s ceiling. Case shuffled into the nearest door and watched the other passengers as he rode. A pair of predatory-looking Christian Scientists were edging toward a trio of young office techs who wore idealized holographic vaginas on their wrists, wet pink glittering under the harsh lighting. The techs licked their perfect lips nervously and eyed the Christian Scientists from beneath lowered metallic lids. The girls looked like tall, exotic grazing animals, swaying gracefully and unconsciously with the movement of the train, their high heels like polished hooves against the gray metal of the car’s floor. Before they could stampede, take flight from the missionaries, the train reached Case’s station. He stepped out and caught sight of a white holographic cigar suspended against the wall of the station, FREESIDE pulsing beneath it in contorted capitals that mimicked printed Japanese. He walked through the crowd and stood beneath it, studying the thing.
124.title: Holographic advertising in a dystopian cyberpunk future
124.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems, methods, and computer-readable storage media for holographic advertising in a dystopian cyberpunk future. In one implementation, a method is performed at a computing device executing a virtual reality (VR) environment simulating a dystopian cyberpunk future. The method includes detecting an object within the VR environment; determining that the detected object corresponds to an advertisement associated with a first user account; identifying a second user account from among a plurality of user accounts corresponding to users participating in the VR environment; generating a holographic representation of the advertisement proximate to the identified second user account; and causing presentation of the generated holographic representation of the advertisement proximate to the identified second user account during execution of the VR environment.

125.content: “People.” “People,” Deane said, around a ginger bonbon. “What sort of people?
125.title: Method and apparatus for identifying a person in an image
125.abstract: A method of identifying a person in an image is provided. The method includes receiving, by one or more processors, the image; determining, by the one or more processors, a plurality of facial landmarks from the image; extracting, by the one or more processors, at least one feature associated with each of the plurality of facial landmarks; converting, by the one or more processors, the at least one feature associated with each of the plurality of facial landmarks into a latent representation; generating, by the one or more processors, a similarity score between the latent representations corresponding to the plurality of facial landmarks extracted from the image and a set of pre-stored templates; and identifying, by the one or more processors, the person in the image based on the similarity score. A system and a computer program product for performing the method are also disclosed

126.content: She held an absurdly elaborate weapon of some kind, a pistol shape nearly lost beneath a flanged overlay of scope sights, silencers, flash hiders. Her legs were spread, pelvis canted forward, her mouth fixed in a leer of idiotic cruelty. Beside her, Armitage stood rigidly at attention in a threadbare khaki uniform. His eyes, Case saw, as Molly stepped carefully forward, were tiny monitor screens, each one displaying the blue-gray image of a howling waste of snow, the stripped black trunks of evergreens bending in silent winds. She passed the tips of her fingers through Armitage’s television eyes, then turned to the figure of Case.
126.title: Method and apparatus for detecting unauthorized access to a computing device
126.abstract: A method of detecting unauthorized access to a computing device is disclosed. In one embodiment, the method comprises receiving an input from a sensor associated with the computing device; determining whether the input satisfies a predetermined criterion; in response to determining that the input satisfies the predetermined criterion, identifying at least one suspicious user profile among a plurality of user profiles corresponding to users authorized to use the computing device; generating a notification message indicative of the identification of the at least one suspicious user profile; and transmitting the notification message to another computing device operatively connected to the computing device.

127.content: “Hate,” Case said. “Who do I hate? You tell me.” “Who do you love?” the Finn’s voice asked. He whipped the program through a turn and dived for the blue towers. Things were launching themselves from the ornate sunburst spires, glittering leech shapes made of shifting planes of light. There were hundreds of them, rising in a whirl, their movements random as windblown paper down dawn streets. “Glitch systems,” the voice said.
127.title: Systems and methods for providing an augmented-reality interface for controlling an autonomous or semi-autonomous unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV)
127.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for providing an augmented-reality interface for controlling an autonomous or semi-autonomous unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV). In one implementation, a method includes receiving sensor data from a UAV. The method also includes determining that the UAV is operating in an autonomous mode. The method further includes generating an augmented-reality graphical user interface (ARGUI), wherein the ARGUI comprises instructions to operate the UAV in accordance with the received sensor data. The method additionally includes transmitting the ARGUI to a remote computing device.

128.content: Magnetic bolts thudded out of position around the massive imitation-rosewood door to the left of the bookcases. JULIUS DEANE IMPORT EXPORT was lettered across the plastic in peeling self-adhesive capitals. If the furniture scattered in Deane’s makeshift foyer suggested the end of the past century, the office itself seemed to belong to its start. Deane’s seamless pink face regarded Case from a pool of light cast by an ancient brass lamp with a rectangular shade of dark green glass. The importer was securely fenced behind a vast desk of painted steel, flanked on either side by tall, drawer Ed cabinets made of some sort of pale wood. The sort of thing, Case supposed, that had once been used to store written records of some kind. The desktop was littered with cassettes, scrolls of yellowed printout, and various parts of some sort of clockwork typewriter, a machine Deane never seemed to get around to reassembling. “What brings you around, boyo?” Deane asked, offering Case a narrow bonbon wrapped in blue-and-white checked paper.
128.title: Apparatus and method for detecting and preventing unauthorized access to a computing device
128.abstract: A system, apparatus, and method are disclosed for detecting and preventing unauthorized access to a computing device. In one embodiment, the present invention provides a computer-implemented method comprising receiving an input from a user of a computing device; determining whether the input is within a predetermined range of inputs that have previously been associated with authorized use of the computing device; responsive to determining that the input is within the predetermined range of inputs that have previously been associated with authorized use of the computing device, permitting the user to continue using the computing device; and responsive to determining that the input is not within the predetermined range of inputs that have previously been associated with authorized use of the computing device, denying continued use of the computing device by the user.

They chose to regard the entire operation as an elaborate private joke, and their choice of comsats seemed to have been deliberate. Molly’s signals were being beamed up from a one-meter umbrella dish epoxyed to the roof of a black glass bank tower nearly as tall as the Sense/Net building. Atlanta.
129.title: Method and apparatus for secure communications over a public switched telephone network (PSTN) or Internet Protocol (IP) network (e.g., Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) network)
129.abstract: A method of establishing a communication session between a first user device and a second user device is disclosed. The method comprises receiving, at the first user device, an invitation to participate in a communication session with the second user device; transmitting, by the first user device, a challenge to the second user device; receiving, at the first user device, a response to the challenge from the second user device; verifying that the response was received from the second user device; and initiating the communication session between the first user device and the second user device when it is verified that the response was received from the second user device. Corresponding apparatus, systems, methods, and computer programs products are also described.

130.title: Systems and methods for authenticating a user of an electronic device
130.abstract: Implementations include systems and methods for authenticating a user of an electronic device. In some implementations, the method includes receiving, by one or more processors, biometric data associated with a user; determining, by the one or more processors, that the biometric data is not sufficient to authenticate the user; in response to determining that the biometric data is not sufficient to authenticate the user, obtaining, by the one or more processors, additional biometric data comprising at least one of facial recognition data, fingerprint data, iris scan data, retina scan data, heart rate data, blood pressure data, pulse oximetry data, electrocardiogram (ECG) data, electromyography (EMG) data, galvanic skin response (GSR) data, glucose level data, body temperature data, respiratory rate data, brain activity data, eye movement data, pupil dilation data

131.title: Apparatus and method for simulating tank warfare
131.abstract: A system, apparatus, and computer-implemented method for simulating combat between tanks is disclosed. An exemplary embodiment of the present invention may include receiving an input from a user to initiate gameplay; determining one or more attributes associated with each of a plurality of tanks that are participating in the gameplay; selecting at least one target tank among the plurality of tanks according to the one or more attributes; transmitting a signal to the selected at least one target tank instructing the selected at least one target tank to fire a projectile toward another tank within range of the selected at least one target tank; calculating a trajectory of the projectile fired by the selected at least one target tank as the projectile travels toward the other tank; predicting where the projectile will strike the other tank along the calculated trajectory; and providing feedback to the user indicating whether the projectile struck the other

132.title: Systems and methods for detecting and responding to anomalies in an autonomous vehicle
132.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for detecting and responding to anomalies in an autonomous vehicle. In one implementation, a method includes receiving sensor data from sensors associated with an autonomous vehicle (AV), wherein the AV is traveling along a roadway. The method further includes determining whether the sensor data satisfies at least one predetermined criterion indicative of an anomaly affecting the AV. If the sensor data does not satisfy the at least one predetermined criterion, the method includes continuing normal operation of the AV. However, if the sensor data satisfies the at least one predetermined criterion, the method includes instructing the AV to exit the roadway.

133.title: Apparatus and method for controlling an autonomous unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV)
133.abstract: A system, apparatus, and method for controlling an autonomous unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) are disclosed. In one embodiment, the UAV comprises at least two rotors configured to propel the UAV in any of six degrees of freedom about its center of gravity. The UAV further comprises sensors configured to provide data indicative of environmental conditions surrounding the UAV. A processor is coupled to the sensors and programmed to control flight of the UAV by adjusting thrust provided by the rotors as a function of information received from the sensors so that the UAV maintains a predetermined orientation with respect to the environment.

134.content: Funny class of people you’re mixing with, Case.” “Never mind,” Case said, turning up the collar of his jacket, “we’ll get the poor fucker a new pancreas or something.” Once they entered the bazaar, the Finn brightened noticeably, as though he were comforted by the crowd density and the sense of enclosure.
