134.title: Apparatus and method for detecting and preventing fraudulent transactions
134.abstract: A system, apparatus, and computer program product are described herein. In an embodiment, the present invention is directed to a point-of-sale (POS) terminal comprising at least one processor configured to receive transaction data associated with a financial transaction between a customer and a retailer; compare the transaction data received from the POS terminal of the retailer against records stored in a memory accessible by the at least one processor; determine whether the transaction data received from the POS terminal of the retailer matches any of the records stored in the memory; responsive to determining that the transaction data received from the POS terminal of the retailer does not match any of the records stored in the memory, approve the financial transaction between the customer and the retailer; and responsive to determining that the transaction data received from the POS terminal of the retailer matches any of the records stored in the memory, deny the financial

135.content: Kicks in your flight reflex, like you’ll be getting signals to run like hell, and a lot of adrenaline.” The steward moved on to Riviera, taking a new set of trodes from his red plastic apron. Case turned his head and tried to make out the outline of the old Orly terminals, but the shuttle pad was screened by graceful blast-deflectors of wet concrete. The one nearest the window bore an Arabic slogan in red spraybomb. He closed his eyes and told himself the shuttle was only a big airplane, one that flew very high.
135.title: Method and apparatus for treating a patient
135.abstract: A method of treating a patient includes positioning an ultrasound transducer in contact with the patient's skin at a treatment site. The ultrasound transducer is configured to transmit therapeutic ultrasonic energy into tissue beneath the patient's skin while simultaneously transmitting diagnostic ultrasonic energy into the same tissue as the therapeutic ultrasonic energy. Therapeutic ultrasonic energy is transmitted by the ultrasound transducer, wherein the therapeutic ultrasonic energy has a frequency between about 100 kHz and about 2 MHz. Diagnostic ultrasonic energy is transmitted by the ultrasound transducer, wherein the diagnostic ultrasonic energy has a frequency that is different from the frequency of the therapeutic ultrasonic energy.

136.content: The shuttles had created the hole with pulse bombs, and Corto’s team had dropped in in Nightwing microlights, their wings snapping taut in moonlight, reflected in jags of silver along the rivers Angara and Podhamennaya, the last light Corto would see for fifteen months. Case tried to imagine the microlights blossoming out of their launch capsules, high above a frozen steppe. “They sure as hell did shaft you, boss,” Case said, and Molly stirred beside him. The microlights had been unarmed, stripped to compensate for the weight of a console operator, a prototype deck, and a virus program called Mole IX, the first true virus in the history of cybernetics.
136.title: Systems and methods for building an artificial intelligence out of toasters
136.abstract: Implementations include systems, devices, and/or methods that may be configured to build an artificial intelligence (AI) out of toasters. In some implementations, one or more computing devices may receive data indicative of a plurality of toasters located within a geographic region. The one or more computing devices may determine whether the plurality of toasters includes at least two different types of toasters. Responsive to determining that the plurality of toasters includes at least two different types of toasters, the one or more computing devices may construct an AI out of the plurality of toasters. The one or more computing devices may train the constructed AI to perform tasks associated with each type of toaster included in the plurality of toasters.

137.content: He caught enough as it was: names like Pauley, Armitage, Sense/Net. Panther Moderns protruding like icebergs from an animated sea of Parisian French. But it was entirely possible that the names were there for his benefit.
137.title: Method and apparatus for identifying a user in a virtual reality environment
137.abstract: A method of identifying a user in a virtual reality environment is provided. The method comprises the steps of: obtaining an image of at least one eye of the user; processing the image to generate a plurality of facial landmarks, wherein each of the plurality of facial landmarks corresponds to a predetermined feature of the user's face; comparing the plurality of facial landmarks with pre-stored facial landmarks associated with users previously identified as being present in the virtual reality environment; and determining that the user is present in the virtual reality environment if there is a match between the plurality of facial landmarks and the pre-stored facial landmarks.

138.content: Their names, or worknames, were Michèle, Roland, and Pierre. Pierre, Case decided, would play the Bad Cop; Roland would take Case’s side, provide small kindnesses—he found an unopened pack of Yeheyuans when Case refused a Gitano— and generally play counterpoint to Pierre’s cold hostility. Michèle would be the Recording Angel, making occasional adjustments in the direction of the interrogation. One or all of them, he was certain, would be kinked for audio, very likely for simstim, and anything he said or did now was admissible evidence. Evidence, he asked himself, through the grinding come-down, of what?
138.title: Case of the disappearing dwarf
138.abstract: Computer-implemented methods, computer program products, and systems are provided. The method may include obtaining data from one or more sensors associated with an autonomous vehicle (AV). The method may also include determining that the AV has entered a case of the disappearing dwarf. The method may further include controlling operation of the AV in response to determining that the AV has entered the case of the disappearing dwarf.

139.content: “If I did know, of course, I might not be in a position to tell you. Things being what they are, you understand.” “Things?” “He’s an important connection Case.” “Yeah. He want to kill me, Julie?”
139.title: Methods, systems, and devices for secure communications
139.abstract: A method of authenticating a user includes receiving an authentication request from the user device. The method also includes transmitting to the user device one or more challenge-response pairs in response to receipt of the authentication request. Each challenge-response pair is configured to be used by the user device to generate a shared secret between the user device and the computing system. In addition, the method includes determining whether the shared secret generated by the user device matches a previously determined shared secret stored at the computing system. If the shared secret generated by the user device matches the previously determined shared secret stored at the computing system, then the user device is authenticated. Otherwise, the user device is denied access to the computing system. Various other methods, systems, and devices are also disclosed herein.

140.content: Under bright ghosts burning through a blue haze of cigarette smoke, holograms of Wizard’s Castle, Tank War Europa, the New York skyline… And now he remembered her that way, her face bathed in restless laser light, features reduced to a code: her cheekbones flaring scarlet as Wizard’s Castle burned, forehead drenched with azure when Munich fell to the Tank War, mouth touched with hot gold as a gliding cursor struck sparks from the wall of a skyscraper canyon. He was riding high that night, with a brick of Wage’s ketamine on its way to Yokohama and the money already in his pocket. He’d come in out of the warm rain that sizzled across the Ninsei pavement and somehow she’d been singled out for him, one face out of the dozens who stood at the consoles, lost in the game she played. The expression on her face, then, had been the one he’d seen, hours later, on her sleeping face in a port side coffin, her upper lip like the line children draw to represent a bird in flight. Crossing the arcade to stand beside her, high on the deal he’d made, he saw her glance up. Gray eyes rimmed with smudged black paintstick. Eyes of some animal pinned in the headlights of an oncoming vehicle. Their night together stretching into a morning, into tickets at the hover port and his first trip across the Bay. The rain kept up, falling along Harajuku, beading on her plastic jacket, the children of Tokyo trooping past the famous boutiques in white loafers and cling wrap capes, until she’d stood with him in the midnight clatter of a pachinko parlor and held his hand like a child. It took a month for the gestalt of drugs and tension he moved through to turn those perpetually startled eyes into wells of reflexive need. He’d watched her personality fragment, calving like an iceberg, splinters drifting away, and finally he’d seen the raw need, the hungry armature of addiction. He’d watched her track the next hit with a concentration that reminded him of the mantises they sold in stalls along Shiga, beside tanks of blue mutant carp and crickets caged in bamboo.
140.title: Systems and methods for managing a user's interaction with a virtual reality environment
140.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for managing a user's interaction with a virtual reality (VR) environment. In one implementation, a method is performed at an electronic device having one or more processors in wireless communication with one or more sensors. The method includes receiving sensor data from the one or more sensors indicative of movement of the electronic device; determining whether the received sensor data satisfies a predetermined criterion; and responsive to determining that the received sensor data satisfies the predetermined criterion, controlling presentation of VR content by the electronic device via a VR headset coupled to the electronic device.

141.content: He left the lobby and located a vending console in a narrow alcove, at the end of a rank of pay phones. He fumbled through a pocketful of lirasi, slotting the small dull alloy coins one after another, vaguely amused by the anachronism of the process. The phone nearest him rang. Automatically, he picked it up.
141.title: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for managing access to computing resources
141.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include methods, systems, and computer-readable media for managing access to computing resources. In one implementation, a method is performed by at least one processing resource comprising at least one processor coupled to non-transitory memory. The method includes receiving, from a client device, a request to establish a connection between the client device and an application running on the at least one processing resource. The method further includes transmitting, in response to receipt of the request, a challenge to the client device. The method further includes receiving, from the client device, a response to the challenge. The method further includes determining whether the response matches the challenge. The method further includes authenticating the client device if the response matches the challenge. The method further includes establishing the connection between the client device and the application upon successful authentication of the client device.

142.content: A transparent cast ran from her knee to a few millimeters below her crotch, the skin beneath the rigid micropore mottled with bruises, the black shading into ugly yellow. Eight derms, each a different size and color, ran in a neat line down her left wrist. An Akai transdermal unit lay beside her, its fine red leads connected to input trodes under the cast. He turned on the tensor beside the Hosaka. The crisp circle of light fell directly on the Flatline’s construct. He slotted some ice, connected the construct, and jacked in. It was exactly the sensation of someone reading over his shoulder.
142.title: Method and apparatus for detecting unauthorized access to a computing device
142.abstract: A method of detecting unauthorized access to a computing device includes receiving, by a processor from an input/output (I/O) component of the computing device, I/O data. The method also includes determining whether the I/O data is within a predetermined range of values. If the I/O data is determined not to be within the predetermined range of values, then the method further includes comparing the I/O data with previously received I/O data stored in a memory associated with the processor. Additionally, if the I/O data is determined not to be within the predetermined range of values and the comparison between the I/O data and the previously received I/O data indicates that the I/O data has been altered, then the method further includes generating an alert indicative of unauthorized access to the computing device.

143.content: We gotta problem.” Maelcum pulled himself up, over Case’s head, twisted, and peered over his shoulder. “Now who is that mon, Case?” “That’s just a picture, Maelcum,” Case said wearily. “Guy I know in the Sprawl. It’s Wintermute talking. Picture’s supposed to make us feel at home.” “Bullshit,” the Finn said.
143.title: Shadowrun novel
143.abstract: A method of playing a role-playing game is disclosed. The method includes receiving an input from a user, wherein the input comprises one or more commands to be performed by a player character controlled by the user; determining whether each of the one or more commands complies with at least one rule associated with the role-playing game; in response to determining that each of the one or more commands does not comply with the at least one rule, providing feedback to the user via a graphical user interface (GUI); and in response to determining that each of the one or more commands complies with the at least one rule, controlling the player character according to the one or more commands.

144.content: Molly left cartons of rice and foam trays of sushi on the corner of the long table. Sometimes he resented having to leave the deck to use the chemical toilet they’d set up in a corner of the loft. Ice patterns formed and reformed on the screen as he probed for gaps, skirted the most obvious traps, and mapped the route he’d take through Sense/Net’s ice.
144.title: Method and apparatus for secure communications over a computer network
144.abstract: A method of authenticating a user device includes receiving, from the user device, a request to establish a communication session between the user device and an application server; determining whether the user device is authorized to communicate with the application server; in response to determining that the user device is not authorized to communicate with the application server, transmitting, to the user device, one or more error messages indicating that the user device is not authorized to communicate with the application server; and in response to determining that the user device is authorized to communicate with the application server, transmitting, to the user device, information enabling establishment of the communication session between the user device and the application server. Corresponding apparatus, systems, techniques and computer programs are also described.

145.content: Chapter Twelve Rue Jules Verne was a circumferential avenue, looping the spindle’s midpoint, while Desiderata ran its length, terminating at either end in the supports of the Lado-Acheson light pumps. If you turned right, off Desiderata, and followed Jules Verne far enough, you’d find yourself approaching Desiderata from the left. Case watched Bruce’s trike until it was out of sight, then turned and walked past a vast, brilliantly lit newsstand, the covers of dozens of glossy Japanese magazines presenting the faces of the month’s newest simstim stars. Directly overhead, along the nighted axis, the hologram sky glittered with fanciful constellations suggesting playing cards, the faces of dice, a top hat, a martini glass. The intersection of Desiderata and Jules Verne formed a kind of gulch, the balconied terraces of Freeside cliff dwellers rising gradually to the grassy tablelands of another casino complex. Case watched a drone microlight bank gracefully in an updraft at the green verge of an artificial mesa, lit for seconds by the soft glow of the invisible casino. The thing was a kind of pilotless biplane of gossamer polymer, its wings silkscreened to resemble a giant butterfly.
145.title: Method and apparatus for controlling a vehicle
145.abstract: A method of controlling a vehicle, the method comprising: determining (S10) whether or not an obstacle is present in a predetermined area; when it is determined that no obstacle is present in the predetermined area, acquiring (S20) information about at least one road surface feature included in the predetermined area; predicting (S30) lateral movement of the vehicle by using the acquired information about the at least one road surface feature; and controlling (S40) steering of the vehicle according to the predicted lateral movement.

146.content: There was only the surging of the alarm, the crashing of the games, his heart hammering. When the fear came, it was like some half-forgotten friend. Not the cold rapid mechanism of the dex-paranoia, but simple animal fear. He’d lived for so long on a constant edge of anxiety that he’d almost forgotten what real fear was. This cubicle was the sort of place where people died.
146.title: Method and apparatus for detecting unauthorized access to a computing device
146.abstract: A method of detecting unauthorized access to a computing device includes receiving, by a processor from an input/output (I/O) controller associated with the computing device, I/O data. The method further includes determining whether the I/O data satisfies one or more predetermined thresholds. In response to determining that the I/O data satisfies the one or more predetermined thresholds, the method also includes identifying at least one suspicious process executing on the computing device using the I/O data. Further, in response to identifying the at least one suspicious process, the method includes preventing execution of the at least one suspicious process.

147.content: Several seconds passed before the scene beyond the window registered through his tension and unhappiness. He looked up and saw a view of Desiderata, expensive shops: Gucci, Tsuyako, Hermes, Liberty. He stared, then shook his head and crossed to a panel he hadn’t bothered examining. He turned the hologram off and was rewarded with the condos that terraced the far slope. He picked up the phone and carried it out to the cool balcony. “Get me a number for the Marcus Garvey,” he told the desk. “It’s a tug, registered out of Zion cluster.” The chip voice recited a ten-digit number. “Sir,” it added “the registration in question is Panamanian.” Maelcum answered on the fifth tone.
147.title: Method and apparatus for controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV)
147.abstract: A method of controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) includes receiving, by the UAV, at least one sensor measurement from each of a plurality of sensors associated with the UAV. Each of the plurality of sensors is configured to measure environmental conditions proximal to the UAV. The method also includes determining whether any of the at least one sensor measurement satisfies a predetermined condition. Responsive to determining that none of the at least one sensor measurement satisfies the predetermined condition, the method further includes adjusting a flight path of the UAV in accordance with a pre-determined trajectory.

148.content: Lines of faint light began to form, verticals and horizontals, sketching an open cube around the stage. The restaurant’s lights had come back up slightly, but the framework surrounding the stage might have been constructed of frozen moonbeams.
148.title: Systems and methods for managing and presenting data in a graphical user interface (GUI)
148.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for managing and presenting data in a graphical user interface (GUI). In one implementation, a method is provided. The method includes receiving an input from a user via a touch-sensitive display screen associated with a computing device. The method further includes determining that the received input corresponds to a selection of at least one item included in a plurality of items displayed by the GUI. The method additionally includes identifying a subset of the plurality of items corresponding to the selected at least one item. Further, the method includes displaying additional information related to the identified subset of the plurality of items.
